                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>

&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;

<item>
            <title>[IO-748] FileUtils.moveToDirectory() exception documentation and exception message error</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-748</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When executing&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
FileUtils.moveToDirectory(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;foobarbaz&apos;&lt;/span&gt;), &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;/tmp&apos;&lt;/span&gt;), &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;)&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;while &quot;foobarbaz&quot; doesn&apos;t exist, I get&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
java.io.FileNotFoundException: Source &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;foobarbaz&apos;&lt;/span&gt; does not exist &lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;but the documentation doesn&apos;t mention &quot;FileNotFoundException&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;OTOH, if &quot;foobarbaz&quot; exists both as source and in the destination directory, I get&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
org.apache.commons.io.FileExistsException: File element in parameter &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;&apos;&lt;/span&gt; already exists: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;/tmp/foobarbaz&apos;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;What&apos;s that &quot;parameter &apos;null&apos;&quot;?&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13399588">IO-748</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.moveToDirectory() exception documentation and exception message error</summary>

<item>
            <title>[IO-744] FileWriterWithEncoding for an existing file no longer truncates the file.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-744</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Creating a new FileWriterWithEncoding for an existing file no longer truncates the file. This was the case in the versions before including 2.10.0.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Starting with 2.11.0 i&apos;m facing issues with files containing my new content but still have the old one if the existing file was larger than the new content.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;commit b2811e86 seems to introduce the problem - i think we should use StandardOpenOption.CREATE_NEW instead of StandardOpenOption.CREATE (inside the initWriter method)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please give me a sign if you&#160; need more details.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13391725">IO-744</key>
            <summary>FileWriterWithEncoding for an existing file no longer truncates the file.</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="2" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg">Critical</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

<item>
            <title>[IO-742] IOUtils.close(Closeable, IOConsumer&lt;IOException&gt;) should not throw IOException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-742</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The method&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void close(Closeable closeable, IOConsumer&amp;lt;IOException&amp;gt; consumer)&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;should not include a &lt;em&gt;throws IOException&lt;/em&gt; clause as the IOException will be handled by consumer (which is the point of the method).&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13387828">IO-742</key>

<item>
            <title>[IO-741] FileUtils.listFiles does not list matching files if File parameter is a symbolic link</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-741</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;This is a regression from 2.6.0.&#160; We are using the following FileUtils utility function to list matching files under a directory:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;public static Collection&amp;lt;File&amp;gt; listFiles(File directory, String[] extensions, boolean recursive)&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In particular the call we are making is:&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;FileUtils.listFiles(extension, new String[]{&quot;jar&quot;}, false);&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This used to return all matching files in 2.6.0 when the directory was a symlink, but it no longer does. Breaking through the code in a debugger, I was able to manually add the FileVisitOptions.FOLLOW_LINKS option, but this is not specifiable from an external caller outside of commons-io.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13386365">IO-741</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.listFiles does not list matching files if File parameter is a symbolic link</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

<item>
            <title>[IO-740] RegexFileFilter matches on full path instead of filename</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-740</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;org.apache.commons.io.filefilter.RegexFileFilter#accept(java.nio.file.Path, java.nio.file.attribute.BasicFileAttributes) is a new method added in 2.9.0 and it&apos;s javadoc states:&#160;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
/**
 * Checks to see &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; the file name matches one of the regular expressions.
 *
 * @param path the path
 * @param attributes the path attributes
 * @&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; the file name matches one of the regular expressions
 */
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;However in it&apos;s implementation:&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; toFileVisitResult(pattern.matcher(path.toString()).matches(), path);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;it matches on path.toString() which will be the full path instead of the filename.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is also inconsistent with the other method &#160;org.apache.commons.io.filefilter.RegexFileFilter#accept(java.io.File, java.lang.String) which does match only on filename.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13383366">IO-740</key>
            <summary>RegexFileFilter matches on full path instead of filename</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="tomjo">Tom Jorissen</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 11 Jun 2021 09:37:05 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 11 Jun 2021 13:01:47 +0000</updated>

                                    <fixVersion>2.10.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Filters</component>
                        <due></due>

<item>
            <title>[IO-739] RegexFileFilter matches on path instead of name</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-739</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The new RegexFileFilter.accept(Path, BasicFileAttributes) uses the full path for matching. When this filter is used in combination with FileUtils.listFiles(File, IOFileFilter, IOFileFilter), then it will not match anything if a path separator is not part of the pattern.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following small program will list all files when used with version 2.8.0 and nothing when used with version 2.9.0:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#770055&quot;&gt;import &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#339999&quot;&gt;org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils&lt;/font&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;font color=&quot;#770055&quot;&gt;import &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#339999&quot;&gt;org.apache.commons.io.filefilter.&lt;/font&gt;*;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#770055&quot;&gt;import &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#339999&quot;&gt;java.io.File&lt;/font&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;font color=&quot;#770055&quot;&gt;import &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#339999&quot;&gt;java.util.Collection&lt;/font&gt;;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#770055&quot;&gt;class &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#339999&quot;&gt;ListFilesRegexBug &lt;/font&gt;{&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160; &lt;font color=&quot;#770055&quot;&gt;public static void &lt;/font&gt;main(&lt;font color=&quot;#339999&quot;&gt;String&lt;/font&gt;[] &lt;font color=&quot;#660088&quot;&gt;args&lt;/font&gt;) {&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &lt;font color=&quot;#339999&quot;&gt;RegexFileFilter &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#6688ff&quot;&gt;filter &lt;/font&gt;= &lt;font color=&quot;#770055&quot;&gt;new &lt;/font&gt;RegexFileFilter(&lt;font color=&quot;#0000cc&quot;&gt;&quot;[^/&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#cc88ff&quot;&gt;\\\\&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#0000cc&quot;&gt;]+&quot;&lt;/font&gt;);&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &lt;font color=&quot;#339999&quot;&gt;Collection&lt;/font&gt;&amp;lt;&lt;font color=&quot;#339999&quot;&gt;File&lt;/font&gt;&amp;gt; &lt;font color=&quot;#6688ff&quot;&gt;files &lt;/font&gt;= &lt;font color=&quot;#339999&quot;&gt;FileUtils&lt;/font&gt;.&lt;font color=&quot;#575757&quot;&gt;listFiles&lt;/font&gt;(&lt;font color=&quot;#770055&quot;&gt;new &lt;/font&gt;File(&lt;font color=&quot;#0000cc&quot;&gt;&quot;.&quot;&lt;/font&gt;), &lt;font color=&quot;#6688ff&quot;&gt;filter&lt;/font&gt;, &lt;font color=&quot;#339999&quot;&gt;TrueFileFilter&lt;/font&gt;.&lt;font color=&quot;#0000aa&quot;&gt;TRUE&lt;/font&gt;);&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &lt;font color=&quot;#770055&quot;&gt;for &lt;/font&gt;(&lt;font color=&quot;#339999&quot;&gt;File &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#6688ff&quot;&gt;f &lt;/font&gt;: &lt;font color=&quot;#6688ff&quot;&gt;files&lt;/font&gt;) {&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &lt;font color=&quot;#339999&quot;&gt;System&lt;/font&gt;.&lt;font color=&quot;#0000aa&quot;&gt;out&lt;/font&gt;.println(&lt;font color=&quot;#6688ff&quot;&gt;f&lt;/font&gt;.getAbsolutePath());&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; }&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160; }&lt;br/&gt;
}&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13383213">IO-739</key>
            <summary>RegexFileFilter matches on path instead of name</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="hzwaal">Hugo Zwaal</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 10 Jun 2021 14:30:17 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 10 Jun 2021 15:38:13 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 10 Jun 2021 15:38:13 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.9.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.10.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Filters</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17361034" author="garydgregory" created="Thu, 10 Jun 2021 15:38:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Please search Jira before creating duplicates.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                <issuelinks>

            <title>[IO-737] RegexFileFilter is broken, matches against path (and not filename)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-737</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;org.apache.commons.io.filefilter.RegexFileFilter.accept(Path, BasicFileAttributes) filters against path&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;should be sth like&#160;&lt;br/&gt;
return toFileVisitResult(pattern.matcher(path.getFileName().toString()).matches(), path);&lt;/p&gt;</description>

<item>
            <title>[IO-736] commons-io version 2.7+: IOUtils.length(boms) returns 0 even if boms is not empty</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-736</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&#160;in&quot;BOMInputStream&quot; class, IOUtils.length(boms) would return 0 and breaks the method while &quot;boms&quot; has five elements:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;image-wrap&quot; style=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;img src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/13026320/13026320_image-2021-06-02-16-47-57-567.png&quot; height=&quot;300&quot; width=&quot;450&quot; style=&quot;border: 0px solid black&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;please investigate and provide a fix, thanks!&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13381807">IO-736</key>
            <summary>commons-io version 2.7+: IOUtils.length(boms) returns 0 even if boms is not empty</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="duanyann">Yan Duan</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 2 Jun 2021 23:48:16 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 8 Jun 2021 22:47:50 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 8 Jun 2021 22:47:50 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.7</version>
                                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17356059" author="garydgregory" created="Thu, 3 Jun 2021 00:29:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hello&#160;Yan Duan,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please test with 2.9.0 and provide a reproducible unit test as a GitHub PR preferably.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;TY&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17356062" author="duanyann" created="Thu, 3 Jun 2021 00:35:42 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt;&#160;I&apos;ve tested with 2.9.0 and the bug still persists, although I&apos;m not able to paste my code due to company restriction, any test calling&#160;IOUtils.length should be able to reproduce this issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;mockStatic(IOUtils.class);&lt;br/&gt;
when(IOUtils.toString(any(BOMInputStream.class), any(Charset.class))).thenReturn(&quot;Success&quot;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;thanks&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17358571" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 7 Jun 2021 12:44:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Please provide a PR on GitHub with an actual unit test or paste a unit test here.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17359641" author="duanyann" created="Tue, 8 Jun 2021 22:47:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt;&#160;it turned out that it was our unit test that didn&apos;t mock the IOUtils.length(boms) function during BOM object creation, which is used in commons-io 2.7 instead of the old way (boms.length). Hence this bug is a false alarm. thanks&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-735] 2.9.0 breaks OSGi with new Import-Package header</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-735</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Upon updating our project to use commons-io 2.9.0 over 2.8.0 - we got build failures due to missing resolution of sun.nio.ch and sun.misc&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;{{missing requirement &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;org.apache.commons.commons-io/2.9.0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; osgi.wiring.package; filter:=&quot;(osgi.wiring.package=sun.nio.ch)&quot;]]&lt;br/&gt;
}}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Running diffoscope over the 2.8.0-&amp;gt;2.9.0 changes I see a new MANIFEST.MF entry:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;Import-Package:&#183;sun.misc,sun.nio.ch&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t think we should import internal Sun packages here.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13381172">IO-735</key>
            <summary>2.9.0 breaks OSGi with new Import-Package header</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="talios">Mark Derricutt</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 30 May 2021 23:15:38 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 8 Jun 2021 12:19:52 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 1 Jun 2021 11:58:17 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>2.9.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>

<item>
            <title>[IO-734] The OSGi manifest now contains sun.* packages in the Import-Package instruction</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-734</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;After attempting to upgrade to commons-io:2.9.0 for apache sling I see that there are now required imports for some sun.* packages in the OSGi manifest.&#160; These references appear to be coming from a new&#160;BufferedFileChannelInputStream class in version 2.9.0.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This results in an error for OSGi environments where those packages are not exposed anywhere.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Specifically this error:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;commons-io:commons-io:2.9.0: is importing package(s) [sun.nio.ch, sun.misc] in start level 5 but no bundle is exporting these for that start level.&#160;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;It would be best if commons-io was not using sun.* packages, but if you must reference those then perhaps those imported packages could be marked optional in the manifest so the commons-io OSGi bundle will not fail to activate when those are not available?&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13381168">IO-734</key>
            <summary>The OSGi manifest now contains sun.* packages in the Import-Package instruction</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>

<item>
            <title>[IO-733] RegexFileFilter uses the path and file name instead of just the file name.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-733</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I had a filename search where I looked for patterns that would not be picked up by surefire but had similar naming. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It is with an &quot;and&quot;, &quot;no&quot;, and a &quot;regex&quot; filter similar to&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
IOFileFilter fileFilter = FileFilterUtils.and(&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//
&lt;/span&gt;            FileFilterUtils.notFileFilter(includeFileFilter), &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//
&lt;/span&gt;            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; RegexFileFilter(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;.*Test.*\\.java&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)); &lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I created a test project to reproduce the issue&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/sellersj/apache-commons-io-issue&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/sellersj/apache-commons-io-issue&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I tested back to version 2.2 and it was the same to 2.8.0. The new behaviour happens with 2.9.0&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13380861">IO-733</key>
            <summary>RegexFileFilter uses the path and file name instead of just the file name.</summary>

<item>
            <title>[IO-730] FloatValidator Considers 1030,1031,1032,1033 Valid</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-730</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FloatValidator Considers 1030,1031,1032,1033 Valid which is not a Valid float value in any Locale I&apos;m aware of.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13372462">IO-730</key>
            <summary>FloatValidator Considers 1030,1031,1032,1033 Valid</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>

<item>
            <title>[IO-729] BrokenReader, BrokenWriter, BrokenInputStream, BrokenOutputStream can cause IllegalArgumentException in combination with try-with-resources</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-729</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The following little code snippet can cause an IllegalArgumentException with message &quot;Self-suppression not permitted&quot;:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; (Writer writer = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BrokenWriter()) {
            writer.write(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;a&apos;&lt;/span&gt;);
        }&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The try-with-resources mechanism will try to add the exception thrown from &lt;tt&gt;close&lt;/tt&gt; as suppress exception to the exception thrown from &lt;tt&gt;write&lt;/tt&gt;. Since those are the same, an exception is thrown. From the source of java.lang.Throwable:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;synchronized&lt;/span&gt; void addSuppressed(Throwable exception) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (exception == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;)
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IllegalArgumentException(SELF_SUPPRESSION_MESSAGE, exception);&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13369481">IO-729</key>
            <summary>BrokenReader, BrokenWriter, BrokenInputStream, BrokenOutputStream can cause IllegalArgumentException in combination with try-with-resources</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="Spoor">Rob Spoor</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 4 Apr 2021 12:54:47 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 4 Apr 2021 12:54:47 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.8.0</version>
                                                    <component>Streams/Writers</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>

                    </subtasks>

                    </customfield>

<item>
            <title>[IO-728] MimeHeaders.setValue throws NPE when IOUtils.copy is called</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-728</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I have a Spring Boot Microservice and I am using &lt;b&gt;IOUtils.copy(InputStream, OutputStream)&lt;/b&gt; which sporadically throws NPE while setting MimeHeaders as shown below:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;2021-03-18 18:14:05.081 ERROR &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;http-nio-80-exec-8&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; o.a.c.c.C.[.[.[.&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;dispatcherServlet&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; - Servlet.service() for servlet &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;dispatcherServlet&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; threw exception2021-03-18 18:14:05.081 ERROR &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;http-nio-80-exec-8&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; o.a.c.c.C.[.[.[.&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;dispatcherServlet&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; - Servlet.service() for servlet &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;dispatcherServlet&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; threw exception&lt;br/&gt;
 java.lang.NullPointerException: null at&lt;br/&gt;
 org.apache.tomcat.util.http.MimeHeaders.setValue(MimeHeaders.java:318) at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.prepareResponse(Http11Processor.java:1285) at org.apache.coyote.AbstractProcessor.action(AbstractProcessor.java:374) at org.apache.coyote.Response.action(Response.java:206) at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11OutputBuffer.doWrite(Http11OutputBuffer.java:219) at org.apache.coyote.Response.doWrite(Response.java:602) at org.apache.catalina.connector.OutputBuffer.realWriteBytes(OutputBuffer.java:352) at org.apache.catalina.connector.OutputBuffer.flushByteBuffer(OutputBuffer.java:833) at org.apache.catalina.connector.OutputBuffer.append(OutputBuffer.java:738) at org.apache.catalina.connector.OutputBuffer.writeBytes(OutputBuffer.java:399) at org.apache.catalina.connector.OutputBuffer.write(OutputBuffer.java:377) at org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteOutputStream.write(CoyoteOutputStream.java:96) at org.springframework.security.web.util.OnCommittedResponseWrapper$SaveContextServletOutputStream.write(OnCommittedResponseWrapper.java:639) at&lt;br/&gt;
 org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils.copyLarge(IOUtils.java:2147) at&lt;br/&gt;
 org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils.copy(IOUtils.java:2102) at &lt;br/&gt;
 org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils.copyLarge(IOUtils.java:2123) at &lt;br/&gt;
 org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils.copy(IOUtils.java:2078)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have attached the complete stack trace in the attachment and also provided the environment where this appears.&lt;br/&gt;
 I feel that there is some issue with the Commons IO lib and would like to know if this can be fixed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;My application has the following code to which the stack trace points to:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(tempOutputFile);&lt;br/&gt;
 return outputStream -&amp;gt;&#160;{ IOUtils.&lt;em&gt;copy&lt;/em&gt;(fis, outputStream); }&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Found the page &lt;a href=&quot;http://tomcat.10.x6.nabble.com/NullPointerException-in-MimeHeaders-td2054107.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://tomcat.10.x6.nabble.com/NullPointerException-in-MimeHeaders-td2054107.html&lt;/a&gt; which talks about a similar problem and coincidentally we too use &lt;b&gt;org.apache.catalina.connector.RECYCLE_FACADES=true&lt;/b&gt; system property to avoid reuse of request and response objects, but it isn&apos;t not working for us as well.&lt;br/&gt;
 &#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Java Version: 1.8&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Spring version:&#160;4.3.11.RELEASE&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Spring boot version: 2.0.5.RELEASE&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Jersey version: 2.16&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13367910">IO-728</key>
            <summary>MimeHeaders.setValue throws NPE when IOUtils.copy is called</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[IO-727] FilenameUtils.directoryContains() and FileUtils.directoryContains() return wrong result when parent and child have the same path prefix</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-727</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FilenameUtils.directoryContains() and FileUtils.directoryContains() will return `true` with the following input.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
canonicalParent: /path/foo
canonicalChild:  /path/foobar
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;There were several issues on this but the problem still remains.&lt;br/&gt;
 &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-423&quot; title=&quot;FilenameUtils.directoryContains assumes separator at end of parent path&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-423&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;IO-423&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; didn&apos;t do anything.&lt;br/&gt;
 &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-466&quot; title=&quot;FileUtils.directoryContains returns wrong response due to startsWith comparison&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-466&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;IO-466&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; test case added in &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/commit/67325cf97946f053da51dd358a9ffca0a9676c03&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;676c03&lt;/a&gt; just happened to passed because the input file didn&apos;t exist.&lt;br/&gt;
Github PR: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/pull/217&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/pull/217&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13367838">IO-727</key>
            <summary>FilenameUtils.directoryContains() and FileUtils.directoryContains() return wrong result when parent and child have the same path prefix</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>

<item>
            <title>[IO-725] FileUtilsDeleteDirectoryLinuxTestCase fails on Mac</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-725</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;After cloning the repository using the command line and running the code on a MacBook Pro there is one test error, as shown below.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Test set: org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsDeleteDirectoryLinuxTestCase
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tests run: 10, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.175 s &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; FAILURE! - in org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsDeleteDirectoryLinuxTestCase
org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsDeleteDirectoryLinuxTestCase.testDeleteInvalidLinks  Time elapsed: 0.004 s  &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; ERROR!
org.apache.commons.io.IOExceptionList: /&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;var&lt;/span&gt;/folders/zz/szdyqxvs5lg94f9ffy016bsr0000gn/T/junit12436802239416119036/realParentDirC
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Cannot delete file: /&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;var&lt;/span&gt;/folders/zz/szdyqxvs5lg94f9ffy016bsr0000gn/T/junit12436802239416119036/realParentDirC/realChildDirD
Caused by: java.nio.file.AccessDeniedException: /&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;var&lt;/span&gt;/folders/zz/szdyqxvs5lg94f9ffy016bsr0000gn/T/junit12436802239416119036/realParentDirC/realChildDirD
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This error was also reproduced in an iMac. The pom.xml version is the 2.9.0-SNAPSHOT, which comes from the GitHub repository here:&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/blob/master/pom.xml&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;Apache Commons-io pom.xml&lt;/a&gt;&#160;The logs are attached below as a txt attachment.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;MacOS Version 10.14.6 (Mojave) on Java 15.0.2 Maven 3.6.1&lt;/p&gt;</environment>

                            <comment id="17305596" author="garydgregory" created="Sun, 21 Mar 2021 01:50:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The build is green on GitHub master here &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/actions&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/actions&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

                            <comment id="17305601" author="garydgregory" created="Sun, 21 Mar 2021 02:11:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;FYI: Symbolic links behave differently on different OSs which can be tricky to account for in the code.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17322890" author="peter stegemann" created="Fri, 16 Apr 2021 10:48:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I ran into this problem on a Linux machine (failed to delete a directory tree with a symbolic link in it), so I cloned common-io from github and tried to build it on my worker machine with Windows and I get the same test failure:&lt;/p&gt;

[ERROR] Tests run: 8, Failures: 3, Errors: 3, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.521 s &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; FAILURE! - in org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsDeleteDirectoryWindowsTestCase [ERROR] org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsDeleteDirectoryWindowsTestCase.testDeleteDirWithSymlinkFile Time elapsed: 0.097 s &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; FAILURE! org.opentest4j.AssertionFailedError: expected: &amp;lt;true&amp;gt; but was: &amp;lt;false&amp;gt;[ERROR] org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsDeleteDirectoryWindowsTestCase.testDeleteDirWithASymlinkDir Time elapsed: 0.07 s &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; FAILURE! org.opentest4j.AssertionFailedError: expected: &amp;lt;true&amp;gt; but was: &amp;lt;false&amp;gt;[ERROR] org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsDeleteDirectoryWindowsTestCase.testDeleteParentSymlink Time elapsed: 0.073 s &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; FAILURE! org.opentest4j.AssertionFailedError: expected: &amp;lt;true&amp;gt; but was: &amp;lt;false&amp;gt;[ERROR] org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsDeleteDirectoryWindowsTestCase.testDeleteDirWithASymlinkDir2 Time elapsed: 0.014 s &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; ERROR! java.nio.file.FileSystemException: C:\Users\tk8tp\AppData\Local\Temp\1\junit11731283517145142303\realouter\fakeinner: A required privilege is not held by the client[ERROR] org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsDeleteDirectoryWindowsTestCase.testDeleteParentSymlink2 Time elapsed: 0.011 s &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; ERROR! java.nio.file.FileSystemException: C:\Users\tk8tp\AppData\Local\Temp\1\junit5595263196221862300\realparent\fakeinner: A required privilege is not held by the client[ERROR] org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsDeleteDirectoryWindowsTestCase.testDeleteInvalidLinks Time elapsed: 0.008 s &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; ERROR! java.nio.file.FileSystemException: C:\Users\tk8tp\AppData\Local\Temp\1\junit4377526187746864700\realParentDirA\realChildDirB\linkToC: A required privilege is not held by the client
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;So the issue is definitely not only for MacOS. My current best guess is that in FileUtils.deleteFile() it calls Files.size() on the symlink and that is what fails.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I still have to try this on Linux.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

            <title>[IO-724] FileUtils.deleteDirectory javadoc is inaccurate for nonexistent directory</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-724</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FileUtils.deleteDirectory javadoc claims:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IllegalArgumentException &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; {@code directory} does not exist or is not a directory&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;but the first two lines of the code are:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Objects.requireNonNull(directory, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;directory&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!directory.exists()) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt;;
}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-721] FileUtils.copyDirectory() tries to set last modified on source dir after update to 2.8.0</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-721</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;A simple&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
FileUtils.copyDirectory(source, dest, glob) &lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;works fine when using Commons-IO 2.7, but fails with&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Caught: java.io.IOException: Failed setLastModified on /path/to/source
java.io.IOException: Failed setLastModified on /path/to/source
 &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.setLastModified(FileUtils.java:2561)
 &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.doCopyDirectory(FileUtils.java:1361)
 &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.copyDirectory(FileUtils.java:733)
 &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.copyDirectory(FileUtils.java:659)
 &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.copyDirectory(FileUtils.java:606)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;after update to 2.8.0. From reading the documentation, it&apos;s also my understanding that &quot;setLastModified()&quot; should be executed on &quot;dest&quot; to set the same modification time as &quot;source&quot;, but &lt;b&gt;not&lt;/b&gt; on &quot;source&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Ubuntu 20.04 LTS&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Groovy 3.0.x&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Java 11 (from Ubuntu packages)&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13364660">IO-721</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.copyDirectory() tries to set last modified on source dir after update to 2.8.0</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="Heinrichs">Dirk Heinrichs</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17301195" author="garydgregory" created="Sun, 14 Mar 2021 16:35:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;A quick scan for the git master and 2.8.0 does not reveal an obvious issue.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;May you please demonstrate your use case in a PR on GitHub? You can create a new class or append to one of the many &lt;tt&gt;FileUtils*TestCase&lt;/tt&gt;&#160;classes.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17301421" author="heinrichs" created="Mon, 15 Mar 2021 06:37:55 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;My use case is a simple Groovy script for copying files from one directory to another:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Copy a directory to a destination directory
&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Get dependencies
&lt;/span&gt;@GrabConfig(systemClassLoader=&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;)
@Grab(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;commons-io:commons-io:2.8.0&apos;&lt;/span&gt;)
@Grab(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;info.picocli:picocli-groovy:4.6.1&apos;&lt;/span&gt;)

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Import external modules
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; groovy.cli.picocli.CliBuilder
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.io.filefilter.WildcardFileFilter

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Parse command line options
&lt;/span&gt;def cli = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; CliBuilder(name: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;copyDir.groovy&apos;&lt;/span&gt;)
cli.h(type: &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Boolean&lt;/span&gt;, longOpt: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;help&apos;&lt;/span&gt;, usageHelp: &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;, required: &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;Show usage information&apos;&lt;/span&gt;)
cli.f(type: File, longOpt: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;from&apos;&lt;/span&gt;, required: &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;, args: 1, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;The directory that should be copied (required)&apos;&lt;/span&gt;)
cli.p(type: &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;, longOpt: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;pattern&apos;&lt;/span&gt;, required: &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;, args: 1, defaultValue: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;*&apos;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;Glob pattern to specify which files to copy (optional, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;default&lt;/span&gt;: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;*&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)&apos;&lt;/span&gt;)
cli.t(type: File, longOpt: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;to&apos;&lt;/span&gt;, required: &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;, args: 1, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;The destination directory (required)&apos;&lt;/span&gt;)
def opts = cli.parse(args)
opts || &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.exit(1)
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt;(opts.h) {
 &#160;cli.usage()
 &#160;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.exit(0)
}

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Copy directory to its destination
&lt;/span&gt;println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;Copying directory &apos;&lt;/span&gt; + opts.f + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos; to &apos;&lt;/span&gt; + opts.t + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos; using glob pattern &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&apos;&lt;/span&gt; + opts.p + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;...&apos;&lt;/span&gt;)
def glob = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; WildcardFileFilter(opts.p)
FileUtils.copyDirectory(opts.f,opts.t, glob as FileFilter)
println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;Directory copied.&apos;&lt;/span&gt;)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Executing this results in above error. Changing the version of commons-io to 2.7 will make it work.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17301535" author="heinrichs" created="Mon, 15 Mar 2021 09:33:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Looking at the code I see that doCopyDirectory() calls a new method FileUtils.setLastModified() in 2.8.0 which throws an exception (with a wrong message, BTW., that should be &quot;targetFile&quot;, not &quot;sourceFile&quot;):&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
 &#160;&#160;&#160;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void setLastModified(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File sourceFile, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File targetFile) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
 &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!targetFile.setLastModified(sourceFile.lastModified())) {
 &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IOException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Failed setLastModified on &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + sourceFile);
 &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;}
 &#160;&#160;&#160;}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;while in 2.7 it calls &quot;destFile.setLastModified()&quot; directly w/o throwing an exception. If that isn&apos;t an obvious issue...&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17301540" author="heinrichs" created="Mon, 15 Mar 2021 09:42:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;BTW: The destination directory in my test was /tmp. Maybe that&apos;s also part of the problem...&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17301545" author="heinrichs" created="Mon, 15 Mar 2021 09:45:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Indeed. Works if I change it to /tmp/foo.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;OK, in this case the only remaining issue is the wrong file being printed by the exception message...&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17329934" author="dariusx" created="Fri, 23 Apr 2021 02:40:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Why does one directory work, but not another?&#160;Is it permissions? I can run&#160; &#160;touch&#160; &#160;on my&#160; /tmp directory.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17329991" author="heinrichs" created="Fri, 23 Apr 2021 05:47:30 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;So do I. However, that doesn&apos;t change the fact that the script above throws an exception when using 2.8.0 and option &quot;-t /tmp&quot;, but doesn&apos;t with &quot;-t /tmp/foo&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17331273" author="dariusx" created="Sat, 24 Apr 2021 17:17:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Looking at the diff between 2.7 and 2.8.0&lt;br/&gt;
 This code:&#160;destDir.setLastModified(srcDir.lastModified());&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;was replaced by&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void setLastModified(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File sourceFile, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File targetFile) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!targetFile.setLastModified(sourceFile.lastModified())) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IOException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Failed setLastModified on &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + sourceFile);
  }
}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;thus throwing an IOException in a situation where it previously did not.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There are comments in the code that show this was intentional.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It seems that the work-around&#160; (which would work in both 2.7 and 2.8.0) is to call the overriddedn copyDirectory() method, and explicitly pass&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;preserveFileDate=false&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17331765" author="heinrichs" created="Mon, 26 Apr 2021 05:36:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Yes, that should work.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;BTW: I mentioned that new method already, see above. Please note that the exception message is wrong, that line should actually be&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
     &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IOException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Failed setLastModified on &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + targetFile);&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Because it&apos;s NOT &quot;sourceFile&quot; whose last modified time it tries to change.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17333290" author="garydgregory" created="Tue, 27 Apr 2021 14:22:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=Heinrichs&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;Heinrichs&quot;&gt;Dirk Heinrichs&lt;/a&gt;&#160;and all,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please look at git master.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Gary&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-719] PathUtils.copyDirectory() does not work when source and dest belong to different file systems</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-719</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;This code:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void pathUtilsCopyDirFailure() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
	FileSystem fs1 = Jimfs.newFileSystem();
	Path srcDir = fs1.getPath(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;srcDir&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Create files/dirs in srcDir
&lt;/span&gt;	Path targetDir = Paths.get(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;targetDir&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
	PathUtils.copyDirectory(srcDir, targetDir);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;throws exception:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;java.nio.file.ProviderMismatchException
	at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixPath.toUnixPath(UnixPath.java:198)
	at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixPath.resolve(UnixPath.java:410)
	at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixPath.resolve(UnixPath.java:43)
	at org.apache.commons.io.file.CopyDirectoryVisitor.preVisitDirectory(CopyDirectoryVisitor.java:130)
	at org.apache.commons.io.file.CopyDirectoryVisitor.preVisitDirectory(CopyDirectoryVisitor.java:36)
	at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree(Files.java:2731)
	at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree(Files.java:2796)
	at org.apache.commons.io.file.PathUtils.visitFileTree(PathUtils.java:687)
	at org.apache.commons.io.file.PathUtils.copyDirectory(PathUtils.java:196)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Java 8, Linux&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13357294">IO-719</key>
            <summary>PathUtils.copyDirectory() does not work when source and dest belong to different file systems</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="ashcheglov">Andrew Shcheglov</reporter>

                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 6 Feb 2021 18:28:52 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 10 Feb 2021 16:23:43 +0000</updated>

                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17280257" author="ashcheglov" created="Sat, 6 Feb 2021 18:34:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Possible solution: stringize relative path inside&quot;resolve()&quot; in &quot;CopyDirectoryVizitor.preVisitDirectory()&quot; and &quot;CopyDirectoryVisitor.vizitFile()&quot;, like here:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Override
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; FileVisitResult preVisitDirectory(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Path directory, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; BasicFileAttributes attributes)
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Path newTargetDir = targetDirectory.resolve(sourceDirectory.relativize(directory).toString());
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (Files.notExists(newTargetDir)) {
		Files.createDirectory(newTargetDir);
	}
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;super&lt;/span&gt;.preVisitDirectory(directory, attributes);
}

@Override
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; FileVisitResult visitFile(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Path sourceFile, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; BasicFileAttributes attributes) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Path targetFile = targetDirectory.resolve(sourceDirectory.relativize(sourceFile).toString());
	copy(sourceFile, targetFile);
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;super&lt;/span&gt;.visitFile(targetFile, attributes);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17280293" author="garydgregory" created="Sat, 6 Feb 2021 20:58:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ashcheglov&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ashcheglov&quot;&gt;Andrew Shcheglov&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you for you report.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A PR on GitHub with a test would be most welcome.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17280896" author="beashish" created="Mon, 8 Feb 2021 09:46:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ashcheglov&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ashcheglov&quot;&gt;Andrew Shcheglov&lt;/a&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Can you assign the Jira to me.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17281339" author="ashcheglov" created="Mon, 8 Feb 2021 20:04:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt;,&#160;is it ok if I add &lt;a href=&quot;https://search.maven.org/artifact/com.google.jimfs/jimfs/1.2/bundle&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;Jimfs&lt;/a&gt; as test dependency to use it in unit tests? Or PR without tests is also acceptable?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17281360" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 8 Feb 2021 20:42:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The JRE provides multiple file systems IIRC: file and zip. Why not test with those? I would expect a test using those two to at least show that the problem is not specific to jimfs. If you can show a failing test with zip and file then we can consider a fix. At that point we could consider additional tests with jimfs but it might not be needed.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17281390" author="ashcheglov" created="Mon, 8 Feb 2021 21:31:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Jimfs uses a much more &quot;light&quot; approach and does not require access to the disk, as the zipfs does.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Ok, I will add jar file to resources then&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17281956" author="ashcheglov" created="Tue, 9 Feb 2021 18:32:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/pull/203&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/pull/203&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

                            <comment id="17282488" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 10 Feb 2021 14:35:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ashcheglov&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ashcheglov&quot;&gt;Andrew Shcheglov&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[IO-718] FileUtils.checksumCRC32 and FileUtils.checksum are not thread safe</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-718</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When calling &lt;tt&gt;FileUtils.checksumCRC32&lt;/tt&gt; from multiple threads (in order to improve throughput when calculating CRC&apos;s for a large folder), the code is not thread-safe, resulting in incorrect CRC output.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following simple test demonstrates the issue:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void should() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; ExecutionException, InterruptedException {
  File testFile = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;C:\\Temp\\large-file.txt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
  &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// ScheduledExecutorService scheduler = Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(1);
&lt;/span&gt;  ScheduledExecutorService scheduler = Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(5);
  List&amp;lt;Future&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Long&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt;&amp;gt; futures = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ArrayList&amp;lt;&amp;gt;();
  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; i = 0; i &amp;lt; 20; i++) {
    futures.add(scheduler.submit(() -&amp;gt; FileUtils.checksumCRC32(testFile)));
  }
  List&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Long&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; crcs = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ArrayList&amp;lt;&amp;gt;();
  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (Future&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Long&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;future&lt;/span&gt; : futures) {
    crcs.add(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;future&lt;/span&gt;.get());
  }
  Assertions.assertThat(crcs).allMatch(c -&amp;gt; crcs.get(0).equals(c));
} &lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In the above code, with a thread-pool size of 1, all calculated CRC&apos;s for the file are the same.&#160; With a thread-pool size of more, the CRC&apos;s differ.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The issue appears to be related to the use of a common &lt;tt&gt;SKIP_BYTE_BUFFER&lt;/tt&gt; in &lt;tt&gt;IOUtils.consume&lt;/tt&gt;.&#160; The multiple threads all read into the same buffer as the data is being &quot;discarded&quot;.&#160; However, &lt;tt&gt;FileUtils.checksum&lt;/tt&gt; uses a &lt;tt&gt;CheckedInputStream&lt;/tt&gt; to calculate the CRC, which uses the value read into the shared buffer.&#160; With multiple threads writing to that buffer the CRC mechanism breaks down.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Apache Commons Io 2.8.0.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;JDK 1.8.0_181.&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13356493">IO-718</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.checksumCRC32 and FileUtils.checksum are not thread safe</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="robabod">Robert Cooper</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 3 Feb 2021 12:33:30 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 17 Feb 2021 16:17:07 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 17 Feb 2021 16:17:07 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.8.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.9.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>

                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17277973" author="robabod" created="Wed, 3 Feb 2021 12:38:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Note that I did not spot anywhere in the documentation that stated the code was not thread-safe, although it&apos;s entirely possible I may have missed it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also worth noting that the code in which we found this issue isn&apos;t calculating the CRC of the same file repeatedly, instead working on different files, but the code listed above is a quick demonstration of the issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17285944" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 17 Feb 2021 16:16:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Note that the char buffer was/is documented as thread unsafe and mentions that buffers (plural) are shared this is not explicitly stated for the byte buufer.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Regardless, this is easy to address. Please see git master or the latest snapshot build.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In general, do not assume thread-safety unless it is stated.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-717] ReaderInputStream does not throw exception with CodingErrorAction.REPORT</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-717</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.io.input.ReaderInputStream&lt;/tt&gt; constructed with a &lt;tt&gt;CharsetEncoder&lt;/tt&gt; with &lt;tt&gt;CodingErrorAction.REPORT&lt;/tt&gt; does not throw exceptions when unmappable or malformed input is encountered. And in some cases can even enter infinite loops.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Example:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
CharsetEncoder encoder = StandardCharsets.UTF_8.newEncoder().onMalformedInput(CodingErrorAction.REPORT);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; (InputStream in = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ReaderInputStream(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StringReader(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\uD800aa&quot;&lt;/span&gt;), encoder, 2)) {
    in.read();
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The reason for this is that the class does not check &lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/docs/api/java.base/java/nio/charset/CoderResult.html#isError()&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;&lt;tt&gt;CoderResult.isError()&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/a&gt; and then call &lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/docs/api/java.base/java/nio/charset/CoderResult.html#throwException()&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;&lt;tt&gt;CoderResult.throwException()&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;hr /&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It would also be good to improve the documentation of the constructors taking a &lt;tt&gt;Charset&lt;/tt&gt; or charset name to describe that they replace unmappable or malformed input with the default replacement character.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13356351">IO-717</key>
            <summary>ReaderInputStream does not throw exception with CodingErrorAction.REPORT</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
