<item>
            <title>[IO-716] ReaderInputStream enter infinite loop for too small buffer sizes</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-716</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.io.input.ReaderInputStream&lt;/tt&gt; enters an infinite loop when it was constructed with a too small buffer size (0 or 1) and one of its reading methods is called.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Example:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; bufferSize = 1;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; (InputStream in = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ReaderInputStream(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StringReader(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\uD800&quot;&lt;/span&gt;), StandardCharsets.UTF_8, bufferSize)) {
    in.read();
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This could be solved by making sure that the buffer size is always &amp;gt;= 2. This should solve this issue because as far as I know all charsets only report &lt;tt&gt;UNDERFLOW&lt;/tt&gt; without encoding any chars if the only char in the buffer is a surrogate.&lt;br/&gt;
However, the saner solution might be to increase the buffer when &lt;tt&gt;UNDERFLOW&lt;/tt&gt; is encountered and no chars from &lt;tt&gt;encoderIn&lt;/tt&gt; have been consumed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;hr /&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Similarly for sanety it would be good to throw an &lt;tt&gt;AssertionError&lt;/tt&gt; (or increase the size of &lt;tt&gt;encoderOut&lt;/tt&gt;) if &lt;tt&gt;OVERFLOW&lt;/tt&gt; is returned. I don&apos;t think there are any encodings which require more than 128 bytes (used by &lt;tt&gt;ReaderInputStream&lt;/tt&gt; for the output buffer) for encoding a single char or flushing, but would be good to at least handle that case in a saner way than entering an infinite loop anyways.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13356350">IO-716</key>
            <summary>ReaderInputStream enter infinite loop for too small buffer sizes</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="Marcono1234">Marcono1234</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 3 Feb 2021 03:18:38 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 17 Feb 2021 16:19:32 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.8.0</version>
                                                    <component>Streams/Writers</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17285948" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 17 Feb 2021 16:19:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=Marcono1234&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;Marcono1234&quot;&gt;Marcono1234&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you for your report.&lt;br/&gt;
Feel free to provide a PR on GitHub with tests &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>
                <customfields>
                                                                            <customfield id="customfield_12310310" key="com.atlassian.jira.toolkit:attachments">
                        <customfieldname>Attachment count</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>

<item>
            <title>[IO-715] ReaderInputStream does not mention behavior regarding CharsetEncoder.reset()</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-715</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Neither the class documentation of &lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.io.input.ReaderInputStream&lt;/tt&gt; nor the documentation of the constructors taking &lt;tt&gt;CharsetEncoder&lt;/tt&gt; arguments describe whether &lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/docs/api/java.base/java/nio/charset/CharsetEncoder.html#reset()&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;&lt;tt&gt;CharsetEncoder.reset()&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/a&gt; is called.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Since calling &lt;tt&gt;reset()&lt;/tt&gt; is part of the &lt;em&gt;encoding operation&lt;/em&gt; (see &lt;tt&gt;CharsetEncoder&lt;/tt&gt; documentation), it should at least be specified whether this method is called or not.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Additionally it &lt;em&gt;might&lt;/em&gt; make sense to call &lt;tt&gt;reset()&lt;/tt&gt; (though this might be a breaking change?) because encoding from a new (&amp;#63;) reader with an already used encoder which is not reset might lead to unexpected and incorrect results.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13356349">IO-715</key>
            <summary>ReaderInputStream does not mention behavior regarding CharsetEncoder.reset()</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>

                    </labels>

                                            <version>2.8.0</version>

<item>
            <title>[IO-714] ReaderInputStream does not call CharsetEncoder.flush(...)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-714</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;As defined by the &lt;tt&gt;CharsetEncoder&lt;/tt&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/docs/api/java.base/java/nio/charset/CharsetEncoder.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;documentation&lt;/a&gt; the &lt;em&gt;encoding operation&lt;/em&gt; consists of:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ol&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;(reset)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;encode&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;flush&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;


&lt;p&gt;However, &lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.io.input.ReaderInputStream&lt;/tt&gt; does not call &lt;tt&gt;flush&lt;/tt&gt;. This leads to incorrect results for charsets whose &lt;tt&gt;flush&lt;/tt&gt; method appends additional bytes.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Example:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Charset whose CharsetEncoder.flush(...) puts bytes
&lt;/span&gt;Charset charset = Charset.forName(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Cp930&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);

&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// \u0391: Causes CharsetEncoder.flush(...) to put additional bytes
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; s = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\u0391&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[] expected = s.getBytes(charset);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[] actual;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; (InputStream in = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ReaderInputStream(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; StringReader(s), charset)) {
    actual = IOUtils.toByteArray(in);
}

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!Arrays.equals(expected, actual)) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; AssertionError(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\n  Expected: &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + Arrays.toString(expected) + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\n  Actual:   &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + Arrays.toString(actual));
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also make sure to check the result of &lt;tt&gt;flush()&lt;/tt&gt; because &lt;tt&gt;OVERFLOW&lt;/tt&gt; as result is possible. In theory &lt;tt&gt;isError() == true&lt;/tt&gt; might be possible as well, but I don&apos;t think any of charset implementations currently return that.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13356348">IO-714</key>
            <summary>ReaderInputStream does not call CharsetEncoder.flush(...)</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="Marcono1234">Marcono1234</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 3 Feb 2021 02:59:54 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 27 Feb 2021 04:24:49 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.8.0</version>
                                                    <component>Streams/Writers</component>
                        <due></due>

                            <comment id="17285950" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 17 Feb 2021 16:20:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=Marcono1234&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;Marcono1234&quot;&gt;Marcono1234&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

                            <comment id="17291913" author="garydgregory" created="Fri, 26 Feb 2021 20:39:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;You do not need an CLA for a &quot;simple&quot; PR, but if you plan on continuing to contribute or your work is not trivial, then an CLA is best.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17292009" author="marcono1234" created="Sat, 27 Feb 2021 01:53:51 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;What exactly is a &quot;simple&quot; PR? I am not very keen on signing the CLA; but please don&apos;t bother changing your CLA process. I had a similar situation with the Eclipse Foundation where they even simplified their CLA process, but in the end still required to (indirectly) publicly provide personal data.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17292018" author="garydgregory" created="Sat, 27 Feb 2021 04:24:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;IANAL but I see this as:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Part of the issue is on whose behalf you would be providing contributions, as an individual or as part as a job you are doing for a company.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;If you care about the legal health of a project and the ASF, you&apos;d sign the appropriate paperwork.&#160;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Please read &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.apache.org/licenses/contributor-agreements.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://www.apache.org/licenses/contributor-agreements.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;I am sure notice the use of the word &quot;desires&quot; which you should balance with any of your own desires for the health of the ASF.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;So it&apos;s up to you. I don&apos;t have any stats as to how many PR contributors have a *CLA on file.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;WRT &quot;simple&quot;, well, that&apos;s a bit subjective but if you were to provide some clever algorithm or a &quot;large&quot; quantity of behavioral changes (as opposed to automated source change a la Eclpise clean ups) then someone would suggest that a CLA would be appropriate.&#160;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;HTH.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-713] ReaderInputStream documentation regarding available() is incorrect</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-713</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The documentation for &lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.io.input.ReaderInputStream&lt;/tt&gt; says:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Given the fact that the Reader class doesn&apos;t provide any way to predict whether the next read operation will block or not, it is not possible to provide a meaningful implementation of the InputStream.available() method. A call to this method will always return 0.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, &lt;tt&gt;Reader&lt;/tt&gt; does actually provide such functionality: &lt;a href=&quot;https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/docs/api/java.base/java/io/Reader.html#ready()&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;&lt;tt&gt;Reader.ready()&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But properly implementing &lt;tt&gt;available()&lt;/tt&gt; might be tricky, see &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/google/guava/pull/5397&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;related Guava pull request&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;br/&gt;
Therefore it might be easiest to change the documentation, stating that &lt;tt&gt;available()&lt;/tt&gt; always returns 0 without providing a reason for it.&lt;br/&gt;
Or &lt;tt&gt;available()&lt;/tt&gt; could at least return a result based on &lt;tt&gt;encoderOut&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13356344">IO-713</key>
            <summary>ReaderInputStream documentation regarding available() is incorrect</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>

<item>
            <title>[IO-712] SecurityExceptions are hidden instead of breaking the regular flow</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-712</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Several points in the code hide SecurityException. These &lt;em&gt;must&lt;/em&gt; always &lt;em&gt;break&lt;/em&gt; the regular control flow, if you&apos;re not the SecurityManager. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;UseCase A: One wants to configure the SecurityManager and grant permissions. Part of the application is to delete a file. If the permission is missing, cleaning does not work. The missing exception does not allow to recognize that.&lt;br/&gt;
 UseCase B: One has activated the SecurityManager. An attacker abuses the relevant method. The missing SecurityException hides this attempt, ones IDS can&apos;t alarm.&lt;br/&gt;
 UseCase C: One utilizes the SecurityManager to test the system, to ensure every property (like file location) is set properly. The missing SecurityException does not support this UseCase.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13355421">IO-712</key>
            <summary>SecurityExceptions are hidden instead of breaking the regular flow</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="2" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg">Critical</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="xf01213">Boris Unckel</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>Security</label>
                            <label>SecurityManager</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 29 Jan 2021 11:26:02 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 30 Jan 2021 08:39:11 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.8.0</version>

<item>
            <title>[IO-705] MarkShieldInputStream#reset should throw UnsupportedOperationException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-705</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The code of&#160;MarkShieldInputStream#reset is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void reset() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IOException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;mark/reset not supported&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The message indicates that it is better to throw&#160;UnsupportedOperationException. Indeed, otehr classes throw that exception in similar contexts:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;WindowsLineEndingInputStream#mark&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;synchronized&lt;/span&gt; void mark(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; readlimit) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; UnsupportedOperationException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Mark not supported&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;NullReader#reset:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;synchronized&lt;/span&gt; void reset() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!markSupported) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; UnsupportedOperationException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Mark not supported&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (mark &amp;lt; 0) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IOException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;No position has been marked&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (position &amp;gt; mark + readlimit) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IOException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Marked position [&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + mark +
                    &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;] is no longer valid - passed the read limit [&quot;&lt;/span&gt; +
                    readlimit + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;]&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        }
        position = mark;
        eof = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;;
    }&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13353442">IO-705</key>

<item>
            <title>[IO-704] FileUtils.requireExists shall throw a more specific exception</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-704</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FileUtils.requireExists throws&#160;IllegalArgumentException when a file does not exist:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; File requireExists(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File file, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; fileParamName) {
        Objects.requireNonNull(file, fileParamName);
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!file.exists()) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IllegalArgumentException(
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;File system element &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; parameter &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + fileParamName + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&apos;&lt;/span&gt; does not exist: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + file + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&apos;&lt;/span&gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; file;
    }

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;It shall throw&#160;FileNotFoundException, which is&#160; more informative. Indeed, another method of this class throws&#160;FileNotFoundException:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; File requireExistsChecked(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File file, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; fileParamName) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; FileNotFoundException {
        Objects.requireNonNull(file, fileParamName);
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!file.exists()) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileNotFoundException(
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;File system element &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; parameter &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + fileParamName + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&apos;&lt;/span&gt; does not exist: &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + file + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&apos;&lt;/span&gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; file;
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13353422">IO-704</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.requireExists shall throw a more specific exception</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="haozhong">Hao Zhong</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 20 Jan 2021 02:42:42 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 17 Feb 2021 16:44:18 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 17 Feb 2021 16:44:18 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17269394" author="garydgregory" created="Thu, 21 Jan 2021 15:51:22 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m not sure what you are asking here. Both method serve different purposes: one throws a checked exception, the other an unchecked exceptions. The call-sites of the unchecked exception method should not be changed to the checked version without changing their signature to go from not throwing to throwing, which we don&apos;t want to do IMO.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-703] FileUtils.directoryContains shall throw NullPointerException for null inputs</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-703</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The code of this method is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; directoryContains(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File directory, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File child) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {        &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Fail fast against NullPointerException
&lt;/span&gt;        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (directory == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IllegalArgumentException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Directory must not be &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        }        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!directory.isDirectory()) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IllegalArgumentException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Not a directory: &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + directory);
        }
       ...
}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;When directory is null, it throws&#160;IllegalArgumentException, but all the other methods of this class throw NullPointerException:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void copyToDirectory(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File src, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File destDir) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (src == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; NullPointerException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Source must not be &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        }
 ....
}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void checkFileRequirements(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File src, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File dest) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; FileNotFoundException {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (src == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; NullPointerException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Source must not be &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (dest == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; NullPointerException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Destination must not be &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!src.exists()) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileNotFoundException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Source &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + src + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&apos;&lt;/span&gt; does not exist&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        }
    }

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13352594">IO-703</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.directoryContains shall throw NullPointerException for null inputs</summary>

<item>
            <title>[IO-702] FileUtils.forceDelete does not delete invalid links</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-702</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The current implementation of FileUtils.forceDelete does not delete invalid links. Invalid links means one pointing to a non existing directory. This is &lt;em&gt;not related&lt;/em&gt; to the intended behaviour to &lt;em&gt;keep the destination&lt;/em&gt; of the link.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The FileUtils.cleanDirectory is based on forceDelete but does not check the result. FileUtils.cleanDirectory assumes &quot;no exception&quot; means &quot;directory is clean&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;FileUtils.deleteDirectory fails with &quot;directory not empty&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Testcase result (will provide that)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
java.nio.file.DirectoryNotEmptyException: /tmp/junit4962570063696933090/realParentDirC
	at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixFileSystemProvider.implDelete(UnixFileSystemProvider.java:246)
	at java.base/sun.nio.fs.AbstractFileSystemProvider.delete(AbstractFileSystemProvider.java:105)
	at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.delete(Files.java:1146)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.delete(FileUtils.java:1173)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.deleteDirectory(FileUtils.java:1192)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsDeleteDirectoryBaseTestCase.testDeleteInvalidLinks(FileUtilsDeleteDirectoryBaseTestCase.java:216)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13352462">IO-702</key>

<item>
            <title>[IO-701] PathUtils.setReadOnly do not deal with LinuxDosFileAttributeView</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-701</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;PathUtils.setReadOnly use a DosFileAttributeView first. If this fails with a Exception, a second try with PosixFileAttributeView will not be done.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The approach is to catch a IOException (java.nio.file.FileSystemException Operation not supported), add it to a exception list. Throw the exception list if not empty.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please check the environment of this bug: integration tests are all run on Ubuntu. This occured on Fedora. (Maybe the difference is ext4 ?)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Example stacktrace (Message is &quot;Operation not supported&quot;)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
java.nio.file.FileSystemException: /tmp/junit4674316189874192997/file1-test.txt: Die Operation wird nicht unterst&#252;tzt
	at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixException.translateToIOException(UnixException.java:100)
	at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixException.rethrowAsIOException(UnixException.java:111)
	at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixException.rethrowAsIOException(UnixException.java:116)
	at java.base/sun.nio.fs.LinuxDosFileAttributeView.updateDosAttribute(LinuxDosFileAttributeView.java:278)
	at java.base/sun.nio.fs.LinuxDosFileAttributeView.setReadOnly(LinuxDosFileAttributeView.java:191)
	at org.apache.commons.io.file.PathUtils.setReadOnly(PathUtils.java:876)
	at org.apache.commons.io.file.PathUtils.deleteFile(PathUtils.java:486)
	at org.apache.commons.io.file.PathUtils.delete(PathUtils.java:393)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.forceDelete(FileUtils.java:1337)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.cleanDirectory(FileUtils.java:303)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.deleteDirectory(FileUtils.java:1189)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsTestCase.setUp(FileUtilsTestCase.java:299)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;java --version&lt;br/&gt;
openjdk 11.0.9.1 2020-11-04&lt;br/&gt;
OpenJDK Runtime Environment AdoptOpenJDK (build 11.0.9.1+1)&lt;br/&gt;
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM AdoptOpenJDK (build 11.0.9.1+1, mixed mode)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;cat /etc/fedora-release &lt;br/&gt;
Fedora release 33 (Thirty Three)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;uname -a&lt;br/&gt;
Linux localhost.localdomain 5.9.16-200.fc33.x86_64 #1 SMP Mon Dec 21 14:08:22 UTC 2020 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ol&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;/etc/fstab&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Created by anaconda on Sat Aug 29 05:35:21 2020&lt;br/&gt;
#&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Accessible filesystems, by reference, are maintained under &apos;/dev/disk/&apos;.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;See man pages fstab(5), findfs(8), mount(8) and/or blkid(8) for more info.&lt;br/&gt;
#&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;After editing this file, run &apos;systemctl daemon-reload&apos; to update systemd&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;units generated from this file.&lt;br/&gt;
#&lt;br/&gt;
/dev/mapper/fedora_localhost--live-root /                       ext4    defaults        1 1&lt;br/&gt;
UUID=fd3a2229-bdf5-4fe5-b596-141b9d6c609f /boot                   ext4    defaults        1 2&lt;br/&gt;
UUID=0C7E-FC8E          /boot/efi               vfat    umask=0077,shortname=winnt 0 2&lt;br/&gt;
/dev/mapper/fedora_localhost--live-home /home                   ext4    defaults        1 2&lt;br/&gt;
/dev/mapper/fedora_localhost--live-swap none                    swap    defaults        0 0&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;
</environment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-700] Add FileUtils.moveFile(srcFile, dstFile, CopyOption...)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-700</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The current implementation 2.8.0 throws an Exception, if moveFiles or copyFiles (with preserveFileDate=true) cannot update the lastModifiedDate. This was not the case in 2.6.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For FileUtils.moveFile the copyFile(File, File) method is used, which results in a copy with preserveFileDate=true. Could you provide a method overload to moveFile similiar to copyFile.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void moveFile(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File srcFile, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File destFile) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
  moveFile(srcFile, destFile, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;);
}

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void moveFile(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File srcFile, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; File destFile, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; preserveFileDate) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
  ...
  copyFile(srcFile, destFile, preserveFileDate);
}

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;(We have a cifs mount where the server is not allowing the update)&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13351366">IO-700</key>
            <summary>Add FileUtils.moveFile(srcFile, dstFile, CopyOption...)</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>

<item>
            <title>[IO-699] Wrong logging in FileUtils.setLastModified</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-699</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;We run into a small issue with FileUtils.copyDirectory(File srcDir, File destDir).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The javadoc is wrong, setting preserveFileDate=true will now result in an IOException if the operation fails. Issue &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-695&quot; title=&quot;Exception while there should be none in copyFile&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-695&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;IO-695&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; already exists for that.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.setLastModified(File, File) sets the lastModified of the targetFile, but the IOException logs &quot;failed setLastModified on &lt;b&gt;sourceFile&lt;/b&gt;&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The setter failed on targetFile - so it should log the &lt;b&gt;targetFile&lt;/b&gt;?&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13351302">IO-699</key>
            <summary>Wrong logging in FileUtils.setLastModified</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[IO-697] IOUtils.toByteArray size validation does not match documenation.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-697</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;According to the javadoc, &quot;throws IOException ... or InputStream size differ from parameter size.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I read that as the passed in parameter size must exactly match the length of data represented by the InputStream. However, the current implementation will:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Throw an exception if size parameter is larger than the InputStream&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Work as expected if size parameter matches size of InputStream&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;&lt;b&gt;Return a byte array only containing up-to size parameter when InputStream is larger than size parameter. No exception is thrown&lt;/b&gt;.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;What is the actual intention of the method? What the javadoc says, or what the implementation is currently doing?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
/**
 * Gets the contents of an &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;InputStream&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; as a &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[]&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt;.
 * Use &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; method instead of &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;toByteArray(InputStream)&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt;
 * when &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;InputStream&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; size is known
 *
 * @param input the &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;InputStream&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; to read from
 * @param size the size of &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;InputStream&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt;
 * @&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; the requested &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt; array
 * @&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException              &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; an I/O error occurs or &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;InputStream&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; size differ from parameter
 * size
 * @&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IllegalArgumentException &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; size is less than zero
 * @since 2.1
 */
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[] toByteArray(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; InputStream input, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; size) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException &lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13349011">IO-697</key>
            <summary>IOUtils.toByteArray size validation does not match documenation.</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="scottyg">scottyg</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 4 Jan 2021 22:22:43 +0000</created>

<item>
            <title>[IO-696] IOUtils.toByteArray throws inconsistent exceptions</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-696</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The code of this method is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[] toByteArray(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; InputStream input, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; size) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {        

      &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (size &amp;lt; 0) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IllegalArgumentException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Size must be equal or greater than zero: &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + size);
        }        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (size == 0) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[0];
        }        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[] data = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[size];
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; offset = 0;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; read;        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt; (offset &amp;lt; size &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (read = input.read(data, offset, size - offset)) != EOF) {
            offset += read;
        }        
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (offset != size) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IOException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Unexpected read size. current: &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + offset + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;, expected: &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + size);
        }        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; data;
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;When size is below zero, it throws&#160;IllegalArgumentException, but when size is not equal to offset, it throws&#160;IOException. It is somewhat confusing. It shall throw&#160;IOException in both cases, in that both cases check legal sizes.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13348198">IO-696</key>
            <summary>IOUtils.toByteArray throws inconsistent exceptions</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="ackelcn">ackelcn</reporter>

<item>
            <title>[IO-695] Exception while there should be none in copyFile</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-695</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;public static void copyFile(final File srcFile, final File destFile, final boolean preserveFileDate)&lt;/tt&gt; java doc says: &quot;If the modification operation fails, no indication is provided&quot;, yet the method raises an &lt;tt&gt;IOException&lt;/tt&gt; &quot;Failed setLastModified on ...&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13346744">IO-695</key>
            <summary>Exception while there should be none in copyFile</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="10003">Resolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="morvael">Dominik Derwi&#324;ski</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 18 Dec 2020 09:04:51 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 19 Jan 2021 08:35:26 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 19 Jan 2021 08:35:26 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.8.0</version>
                                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17252499" author="garydgregory" created="Sun, 20 Dec 2020 19:35:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve reworked some of the docs, please see git master for the current Javadoc.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17255464" author="morvael" created="Mon, 28 Dec 2020 08:15:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Code behaving like the Javadoc says would be better than altering the Javadoc to match how the code works. But I understand throwing exception is WAD.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17255619" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 28 Dec 2020 15:22:51 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=morvael&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;morvael&quot;&gt;Dominik Derwi&#324;ski&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;What do you mean by WAD in this context?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17255627" author="morvael" created="Mon, 28 Dec 2020 15:40:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;That throwing the exception for this optional operation is working as designed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For me, the main operation here is copying the file. I don&apos;t need an exception if the copy operation succeeds, but setting last modified time fails.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17262436" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 11 Jan 2021 06:56:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=morvael&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;morvael&quot;&gt;Dominik Derwi&#324;ski&lt;/a&gt;,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The copy API makes sure that the operation you asked it to perform (preserveFileDate=true) actually worked. Since failing silently is what the JRE does (no exception is thrown, instead the method returns a boolean), we validate this operation manually by throwing an IOException. As I am sure you know, most JRE IO APIs throw IOException, but for some of these very old APIs, they return a boolean instead.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you do not care about a failure when setting the file&apos;s timestamp, then do not ask for that operation to be performed in the first place by setting preserveFileDate to false.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Now that the docs are fixed, we can close this ticket IMO.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17262451" author="morvael" created="Mon, 11 Jan 2021 07:21:25 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m not sure not setting the date at all is the same as ignoring failure to set it. It&apos;s a bonus operation, that is welcome if it succeeds, but nothing dramatic happens if it doesn&apos;t. Perhaps there need to be multiple versions of the method.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17266659" author="garydgregory" created="Sat, 16 Jan 2021 21:03:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=morvael&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;morvael&quot;&gt;Dominik Derwi&#324;ski&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please try again with git master as the internals are now different.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Comment here or close the ticket.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;TY&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17267745" author="morvael" created="Tue, 19 Jan 2021 08:35:05 +0000"  >&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;     * &amp;lt;strong&amp;gt;Note:&amp;lt;/strong&amp;gt; Setting &amp;lt;code&amp;gt;preserveFileDate&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt; to {@code true} tries to preserve the file&apos;s last
     * modified date/times using {@link File#setLastModified(long)}, however it is not guaranteed that the operation
     * will succeed. If the modification operation fails, the methods throws IOException.
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Guess I&apos;ll have to settle with just corrected javadoc. But it&apos;s still an improvement, when you can&apos;t be nastily surprised by undocumented exception, right?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[IO-694] Behaviour change in FileUtils.copyDirectory() file last modified date/times preservation</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-694</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;API documentation for FileUtils.copyDirectory() says:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;Note: This method tries to preserve the files&apos; last modified date/times using File.setLastModified(long), however it is not guaranteed that those operations will succeed. If the modification operation fails, &lt;b&gt;no indication is provided&lt;/b&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;(bold emphasis added)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In version 2.7 the &quot;no indication is provided&quot; part is true - if the last modified date/times could not changed, then the FileUtils.copyDirectory() will still succeed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In version 2.8.0, if the last modified date/times could not changed, then the FileUtils.copyDirectory() will throw an IOException. However, the API documentation is not updated, so the documentation and the implementation are inconsistent.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The behaviour change in 2.8.0 can be traced to commit b99b3f9f484074454c6d67ec658a4e0e8555ffd2 (Throw an IOException if calling setLastModified() fails.).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please do &lt;b&gt;one&lt;/b&gt; of the following:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Update the documentation to say that an IOException will be thrown.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;Revert the implementation to the previous behaviour.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Thanks.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13345205">IO-694</key>
            <summary>Behaviour change in FileUtils.copyDirectory() file last modified date/times preservation</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="yeefan-ncs">Tan Yee Fan</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 10 Dec 2020 06:25:57 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 11 Dec 2020 05:17:44 +0000</updated>

                            <comment id="17247463" author="garydgregory" created="Thu, 10 Dec 2020 19:51:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=yeefan-ncs&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;yeefan-ncs&quot;&gt;Tan Yee Fan&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Thank you for your ticket. I updated the Javadoc. Please verify in git master and close this ticket if appropriate.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17247633" author="yeefan-ncs" created="Fri, 11 Dec 2020 04:52:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the prompt response and commit.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, the documentation fix is incomplete because there are many copyDirectory methods in FileUtils. (I noticed that you also modified one of the copyFile methods, but I didn&apos;t verify which code paths eventually attempt to modify the file timestamp(s).)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Perhaps you want to search for all instances of &quot;no indication is provided&quot;?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17247637" author="garydgregory" created="Fri, 11 Dec 2020 05:01:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=yeefan-ncs&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;yeefan-ncs&quot;&gt;Tan Yee Fan&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

                        <customfieldname>Time in Status</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                            </customfields>
    </item>


<item>
            <title>[IO-692] PathUtils delete throws an exception when deleting a symlink that points to a file that does not exist</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-692</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;PathUtils.delete&lt;/b&gt; throws an Exception when deleting a symlink to a file that doesn&apos;t exist, in our case this was when the files were deleted out of sequence.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Minimal reproducing code running as a unit test (scala). This creates a symlink to a fail that does not exist at all.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
val file = Files.createSymbolicLink(
  Paths.get(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;target&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;x.txt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;),
  Paths.get(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;target&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,  &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;y.txt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;).toAbsolutePath,
)
PathUtils.delete(file)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This throws the following exception&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;[error]    java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException: target/x.txt (UnixException.java:86)
[error] sun.nio.fs.UnixException.translateToIOException(UnixException.java:86)
[error] sun.nio.fs.UnixException.rethrowAsIOException(UnixException.java:102)
[error] sun.nio.fs.UnixException.rethrowAsIOException(UnixException.java:107)
[error] sun.nio.fs.UnixFileAttributeViews$Basic.readAttributes(UnixFileAttributeViews.java:55)
[error] sun.nio.fs.UnixFileSystemProvider.readAttributes(UnixFileSystemProvider.java:144)
[error] org.apache.commons.io.file.PathUtils.deleteFile(PathUtils.java:361)
[error] org.apache.commons.io.file.PathUtils.delete(PathUtils.java:304)
[error] org.apache.commons.io.file.PathUtils.delete(PathUtils.java:280)&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The offending code is this in&#160;&lt;b&gt;PathUtils&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; PathCounters deleteFile(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Path file, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; DeleteOption... options) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Files.deleteIfExists() never follows links, so use LinkOption.NOFOLLOW_LINKS in other calls to Files.
&lt;/span&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (Files.isDirectory(file, LinkOption.NOFOLLOW_LINKS)) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; NoSuchFileException(file.toString());
    }
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; PathCounters pathCounts = Counters.longPathCounters();
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; exists = Files.exists(file, LinkOption.NOFOLLOW_LINKS);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; size = exists ? Files.size(file) : 0;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (overrideReadOnly(options) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; exists) {
        setReadOnly(file, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;, LinkOption.NOFOLLOW_LINKS);
    }
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (Files.deleteIfExists(file)) {
        pathCounts.getFileCounter().increment();
        pathCounts.getByteCounter().add(size);
    }
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; pathCounts;
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This manifests because&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Files.exists(file, LinkOption.NOFOLLOW_LINKS); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; always returns &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; the symlink exists
&lt;/span&gt;
Files.size(file) &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; an exception because there is no file to check the size of&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;A guess at the solution would be to only check the size if the file exists and is not a symlink&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; size = exists &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !Files.isSymbolicLink() ? Files.size(file) : 0;&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This was discovered when using &lt;b&gt;FileUtils.deleteDirectory&lt;/b&gt;&#160;where we have a structure like the following. We clean up these directories when the process finishes, since upgrading to 2.8.0 this fails if the parent directory is deleted before the child.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
 work_dir/
   parent_dir/
     big_file.txt
   child_dir/
     symlink_to_big_file.txt&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;As a work around using&#160;&lt;b&gt;PathUtils.deleteDirectory&lt;/b&gt; seems to work regardless of the deletion order&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;java version &quot;1.8.0_202&quot; Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_202-b08) Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.202-b08, mixed mode)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</environment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-691] IOUtils copyLarge gives incorrect result with buffered stream and zip file</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-691</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I run the following code&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.io.*;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Scratch {

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; oldFilePath = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;your_path/test.zip&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; newFilePath = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;your_path/new_zip.zip&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        InputStream inputStream = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileInputStream(oldFilePath);

        File file = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(newFilePath);
        file.createNewFile();

        IOUtils.copyLarge(inputStream, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BufferedOutputStream(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileOutputStream(file)));
    }
}

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I then try to open the new_zip.zip and it is impossible to open, the file is not well copied&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However if I remove the BufferedOutputStream as below, the copy works correctly &lt;/p&gt;

 &lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.io.*;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Scratch {

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; oldFilePath = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;your_path/test.zip&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; newFilePath = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;your_path/new_zip.zip&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        InputStream inputStream = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileInputStream(oldFilePath);

        File file = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(newFilePath);
        file.createNewFile();

        IOUtils.copyLarge(inputStream, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileOutputStream(file));
    }
}

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Mac OS Catalina v 10.15.7&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Java 11&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;MacBook Pro (16-inch, 2019)&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13337639">IO-691</key>
            <summary>IOUtils copyLarge gives incorrect result with buffered stream and zip file</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="10004">Not A Bug</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="aymondebroglie">Aymon de Broglie</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 28 Oct 2020 10:55:41 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 29 Oct 2020 08:07:33 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 29 Oct 2020 08:07:33 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.8.0</version>
                                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17222109" author="alexherbert" created="Wed, 28 Oct 2020 11:34:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The IOUtils.copy methods do not close the input or output streams. This allows the output stream to be used for more writing after the copy has completed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I would guess that the BufferedOutputStream still has data in the buffer and needs to be closed. Try this which uses a try-with-resources to auto close the input and output streams:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; oldFilePath = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;your_path/test.zip&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; newFilePath = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;your_path/new_zip.zip&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; (InputStream in = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileInputStream(oldFilePath);
             BufferedOutputStream out = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BufferedOutputStream(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileOutputStream(newFilePath))) {
            IOUtils.copyLarge(in, out);
        }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17222118" author="aymondebroglie" created="Wed, 28 Oct 2020 12:08:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for your comment, I tried to run your code with a try and I have the same problem, the new zip cannot be opened !&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17222173" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 28 Oct 2020 13:49:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Unless you need to use streams, don&apos;t, use one of:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.copyFile(File, File)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;java.nio.file.Files.copy(Path, Path, CopyOption...)&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17222325" author="alexherbert" created="Wed, 28 Oct 2020 18:05:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I can confirm that when I use the try-with-resources code above the test.zip file is copied as expected and is binary equal to the original using the &lt;tt&gt;diff&lt;/tt&gt; command. So a few questions:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Can you open the original file?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Are the before and after files binary different using &lt;tt&gt;diff&lt;/tt&gt;?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If they are different can you provide a file size for the files before and after copy on your machine (i.e. is some byte data missing)?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It would be good if this problem can be put into a test case so it is reproducible.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17222760" author="aymondebroglie" created="Thu, 29 Oct 2020 08:04:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Sorry, I just re run your code example I did not see that you had put both of the streams in the try. It does work as well so the issue is probably the buffered stream as you said.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the help !&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17222763" author="alexherbert" created="Thu, 29 Oct 2020 08:07:33 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Copy to the output stream requires explicit close after the copy has ended.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                            <attachment id="13014279" name="test.zip" size="255" author="aymondebroglie" created="Wed, 28 Oct 2020 10:55:28 +0000"/>
                    </attachments>

                        <customfieldname>Rank (Obsolete)</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>9223372036854775807</customfieldvalue>

                    </customfield>
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                <customfield id="customfield_12310222" key="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus">
