                <customfields>
                                                                            <customfield id="customfield_12310310" key="com.atlassian.jira.toolkit:attachments">
                        <customfieldname>Attachment count</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>0.0</customfieldvalue>
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        <customfield id="customfield_12310220" key="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate">

                            <comment id="16986325" author="jochen@apache.org" created="Mon, 2 Dec 2019 20:08:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Why do you consider this a bug? Throwing an NPE, if either parameter is null, makes perfect sense to me. What else should the method do?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Besides, that behaviour is even documented. Quoting the&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;[Javadoc API|&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-io/javadocs/api-release/index.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-io/javadocs/api-release/index.html&lt;/a&gt;]&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Throws:&lt;tt&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/NullPointerException.html?is-external=true&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;NullPointerException&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/tt&gt;&#160;- if either input is null&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-639] ReversedLinesFileReader does not read first line if it&apos;s empty</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-639</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;ReversedLinesFileReader does not seem to read the first if the the line is empty. Consider the content of a file:&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
\n
test\n
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;where the first line is simple a newline character. If ReversedLinesFileReader is used to read the file in reverse, then only the 2nd line is read - in the subsequent call, &lt;tt&gt;::readLine&lt;/tt&gt; return null.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Here is a Java test that was tried:&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;ReversedFileReaderTest {

    @ParameterizedTest
    @MethodSource(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;contentAndExpectedProvider&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)
    void testReadLineInReverse_givenTwoLines(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; content, List&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; expected)
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {

        File file = Files.newTemporaryFile();
        java.nio.file.Files.write(Path.of(file.getPath()), content.getBytes());

        List&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; lines = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ArrayList&amp;lt;&amp;gt;();

        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; (ReversedLinesFileReader fileReader = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ReversedLinesFileReader(file,
                StandardCharsets.UTF_8)) {

            &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; line;
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt; ((line = fileReader.readLine()) != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
                lines.add(line);
            }
        }

        assertThat(lines).isEqualTo(expected);
    }

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; Stream&amp;lt;Arguments&amp;gt; contentAndExpectedProvider() {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; Stream.of(
                arguments(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;the\ntest\n&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Arrays.asList(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;test&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;the&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)),
                arguments(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\ntest\n&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Arrays.asList(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;test&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &quot;&quot;)),
                arguments(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\n\ntest\n&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Arrays.asList(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;test&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&quot;, &quot;&lt;/span&gt;&quot;)),
                arguments(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\n\n&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Arrays.asList(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&quot;, &quot;&lt;/span&gt;&quot;)),
                arguments(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\n&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Arrays.asList(&quot;&quot;))
        );
    }
}

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Only the first test case runs. All the last four fails&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13270241">IO-639</key>
            <summary>ReversedLinesFileReader does not read first line if it&apos;s empty</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[IO-638] Infinite loop in CharSequenceInputStream.read for 4-byte characters with UTF-8 and 3-byte buffer.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-638</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In the constructor of `CharSequenceInputStream` there is the following code to ensure the buffer is large enough to hold one character:&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
 &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Ensure that buffer is &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; enough to hold a complete character   
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;float&lt;/span&gt; maxBytesPerChar = encoder.maxBytesPerChar();      
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (bufferSize &amp;lt; maxBytesPerChar) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IllegalArgumentException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Buffer size &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + bufferSize + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot; is less than maxBytesPerChar &quot;&lt;/span&gt; +
    maxBytesPerChar);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;However, for UTF-8, `maxBytesPerChar` returns 3.0 not 4.0, even though some characters (such as emoji) require 4 bytes to encode.&#160; As a result you can create a `CharSequenceInputStream` with a buffer size of 3, but when attempting to fill the buffer, `CharsetEncoder.encode` will succeed with an OVERFLOW result without actually writing anything to buffer if attempting to encode a 4 byte character. This in turn results in an infinite loop in read methods, since the buffer never actually gets anything written to it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;NOTE: as I understand it, the reason the encoder returns 3 and not 4 is because 3 is the maximum number of byte that a single java `char` can represent, since a 4 byte encoding in UTF-8 would require two a surragate pair of two `char`s.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is may be a problem for other encodings as well, but I&apos;ve only tested it for utf-8.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Requiring the buffer to be at least twice the maxBytesPerChar would ensure this doesn&apos;t happen.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13268376">IO-638</key>
            <summary>Infinite loop in CharSequenceInputStream.read for 4-byte characters with UTF-8 and 3-byte buffer.</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="thayne2">Thayne McCombs</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 14 Nov 2019 17:09:35 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 18 Jan 2021 21:14:24 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.6</version>
                                                    <component>Streams/Writers</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17267534" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 18 Jan 2021 21:14:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=thayne2&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;thayne2&quot;&gt;Thayne McCombs&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[IO-625] FileUtils.copyDirectoryToDirectory does not reflect srcDir in exception message when srcDir is not a directory</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-625</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When srcDir parameter to FileUtils.copyDirectoryToDirectory method is not a directory, exception message contains destDir instead of srcDir.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Related issue is, that based on Javadocs one would expect IOException instead of IllegalArgumentException. Changing type of the exception would probably break some clients. Fixing message seems reasonable.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13255485">IO-625</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.copyDirectoryToDirectory does not reflect srcDir in exception message when srcDir is not a directory</summary>

<item>
            <title>[IO-624] IOUtils.writeLines updating incompatible issue</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-624</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following code snippets throw an incompatible issue when I try to rolling update Commons-io from 2.2 to 2.6.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void test() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException{
	
	File TestFile = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File( &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;test.txt&quot;&lt;/span&gt; );
	OutputStream out = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
	List&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; lines = Arrays.asList(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;a&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;b&quot;&lt;/span&gt;,&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;c&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
        out = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileOutputStream(TestFile, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;);
        IOUtils.writeLines(lines, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;, out, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;);
    } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;finally&lt;/span&gt; {
        IOUtils.closeQuietly(out);
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;


&lt;p&gt;It throws an error:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
error: reference to writeLines is ambiguous
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-623] IOUtils.lineIterator updating incompatible issue</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-623</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following code snippets throw an incompatible issue when I try to rolling update Commons-io from 2.1 to 2.6.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Some comments here
&lt;/span&gt;@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void Test() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException{
	LineIterator iter = IOUtils.lineIterator (getClass ().getResourceAsStream (&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/tmp/test.txt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;), &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It throws an error:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
reference to lineIterator is ambiguous
[ERROR] both method lineIterator(java.io.InputStream,java.nio.charset.Charset) in org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils and method lineIterator(java.io.InputStream,java.lang.&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;) in org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils match
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13251360">IO-623</key>
            <summary>IOUtils.lineIterator updating incompatible issue</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="10008">Information Provided</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="lingchao">xia0c</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>performance</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 17 Aug 2019 00:31:32 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 9 Aug 2020 13:51:50 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 9 Aug 2020 13:51:50 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.6</version>
                                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16909932" author="kinow" created="Sun, 18 Aug 2019 10:28:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I am not sure if that&apos;s a backward incompatibility.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The issue is that the second argument getting a `null` could be for the method `IOUtils.lineIterator(Reader, String)` that was available in 2.1.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Or it could be for the method `IOUtils.lineIterator(Reader, Charset)`. The JVM has no way to tell which of these two methods you are invoking.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As far as I remember, adding methods is fine, regarding binary backward compatibility. But I am not sure if there is any rule regarding overloaded methods.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But in case you just need a quick fix, that would be to cast your null to either (String) null, or (Charset) null.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Bruno&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[IO-622] FileUtils.readLines incompatible issue</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-622</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following code snippets throw an incompatible issue when I try to rolling update Commons IO to 2.6. It works well before 2.3.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void DemoTest(){

	List&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; l = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ArrayList();
	File TestFile = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;TestFile&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
	    l.addAll(org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.readLines(TestFile, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;));
	} &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (IOException e) {
	    e.printStackTrace();
	}
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks a lot.&lt;/p&gt;
</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13251339">IO-622</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.readLines incompatible issue</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="10008">Information Provided</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="lingchao">xia0c</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>performance</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 16 Aug 2019 21:37:24 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 10 Aug 2020 15:06:44 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 10 Aug 2020 15:06:36 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.3</version>
                    <version>2.4</version>
                    <version>2.5</version>
                    <version>2.6</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17174379" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 10 Aug 2020 15:06:36 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;There used to be just one readLines method with two parameters:&lt;br/&gt;
FileUtils.readLines(File, String encoding)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There are now two such methods:&lt;br/&gt;
FileUtils.readLines(File, String)&lt;br/&gt;
FileUtils.readLines(File, Charset)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The compiler can no longer determine whether the null parameter is a String, or a Charset.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You will have to change the source and recompile.&lt;br/&gt;
e.g.&lt;br/&gt;
FileUtils.readLines(TestFile, (String) null);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note that the additional method does not affect binary compatibility.&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;The compiled code includes the method signature, so the JVM can find the correct method to call.&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>
                <customfields>

<item>
            <title>[IO-621] Updating source incompatible issue</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-621</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following code snippets throw an incompatible issue when I try to rolling update Commons IO from 2.4 to 2.6.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void DemoTest(){
	
    LineIterator it = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
    File TestFile = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;TestFile&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
        it = FileUtils.lineIterator(TestFile , &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;UTF-8&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt; (it.hasNext()) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; line = it.nextLine();
        }
    } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (IOException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;finally&lt;/span&gt; {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (it != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;)
            it.close();
    }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Thanks a lot.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

                            <comment id="16925189" author="tai" created="Sun, 8 Sep 2019 15:24:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ggregory&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ggregory&quot;&gt;Gary D. Gregory&lt;/a&gt; &lt;b&gt;LineIterator&lt;/b&gt; class has made incompatible changes in &lt;b&gt;c1d92d87&lt;/b&gt; submission since &lt;b&gt;2.5&lt;/b&gt;, which seems to need to be modified again?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16925192" author="garydgregory" created="Sun, 8 Sep 2019 15:38:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;How so?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16925196" author="tai" created="Sun, 8 Sep 2019 15:48:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The &lt;b&gt;close&lt;/b&gt; method in the &lt;b&gt;LineIterator&lt;/b&gt; class throws an &lt;font color=&quot;#DE350B&quot;&gt;IOException&lt;/font&gt; in the c1d92d87 commit.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void close() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
        finished = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;;
        cachedLine = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;.bufferedReader != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;.bufferedReader.close();
        }
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16925203" author="garydgregory" created="Sun, 8 Sep 2019 16:25:51 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=lingchao&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;lingchao&quot;&gt;xia0c&lt;/a&gt;,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Ah, I see. This is a &lt;em&gt;source&lt;/em&gt;&#160;incompatible change but it &lt;em&gt;is&lt;/em&gt; &lt;b&gt;binary compatible,&lt;/b&gt;&#160;therefore it will not be reverted. You must therefore update you source code.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In general, we only keep binary compatibility between minor releases. We do not guarantee source compatibility.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you,&lt;br/&gt;
Gary&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-620] FileUtils.writeStringToFile does not close() stream</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-620</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FileUtils.writeStringToFile() method does not close the OutputStream.&#160; This can lead to running out of file descriptors, inability to write to the file a second time (Windows), and unpredictable file contents (Unix).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&#160;&#160; public static void writeStringToFile(final File file, final String data, final Charset encoding,&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; final boolean append) throws IOException {&lt;br/&gt;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; try (OutputStream out = openOutputStream(file, append)) &lt;/p&gt;
{
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; IOUtils.write(data, out, encoding);
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; }
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&#160;&#160; }&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The stream is closed in version 2.5, but not in 2.6.&#160; It may have been introduced on the following commit:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/commit/4dc97b64005f0083b2facaa70f661138a4fa3fc0#diff-5999114d4c52063bbe7063696cf20215&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/commit/4dc97b64005f0083b2facaa70f661138a4fa3fc0#diff-5999114d4c52063bbe7063696cf20215&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13250551">IO-620</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.writeStringToFile does not close() stream</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="erilong">Eric Long</reporter>

                            <comment id="16906244" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Tue, 13 Aug 2019 14:16:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Try with resources is supposed to close the file.&lt;br/&gt;
Is that not happening?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16906280" author="erilong" created="Tue, 13 Aug 2019 14:41:30 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It looks like you&apos;re right, the &quot;try with resources&quot; should auto-close the resource.&#160; I apologize, I didn&apos;t know Java had that feature.&#160; I was auditing the code and thought the close() was missing.&#160; You can close this issue, or even delete it and spare my embarrassment.&#160; &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-611] FilenameUtils.normalize does not sanitize multiple slashes after prefix</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-611</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FilenameUtils.#normalize states in javadoc that //foo//./bar becomes /foo/bar&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(FilenameUtils.normalize(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//foo//./bar&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(FilenameUtils.normalize(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;\\\\foo\\\\.\\bar&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Result:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//foo//bar
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//foo//bar&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;So, javadoc says, that it should be /foo/bar. I think, that //foo is prefix, so it should be //foo/bar. But in real life it becomes the third way (//foo//bar).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think we should fix javadoc and the code. The correct result should be //foo/bar&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13248346">IO-611</key>
            <summary>FilenameUtils.normalize does not sanitize multiple slashes after prefix</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>

                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>

<item>
            <title>[IO-609] FileUtils.copyToFile backward incompatibility bug</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-609</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following code snippets throw an IOException: Stream closed. It works well before commons-io 2.6. When I update commons-io to 2.6, it failed. There is a backward incompatibility bug behind it.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The function code:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Demo {
	  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; void backupFile(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; srcPath, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; entryPath, ZipOutputStream stream) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
		    ZipEntry zipEntry = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ZipEntry(entryPath);
		    stream.putNextEntry(zipEntry);
		    Files.copy(Paths.get(srcPath), stream);
		  }
	  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; void backupDir(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; srcDir, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; dstDir, ZipOutputStream stream) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
		    File dir = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(srcDir);
		    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; path : dir.list()) {
		      &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(path);
		      backupFile(dir.getAbsolutePath() + File.separator + path, dstDir + File.separator + path, stream);
		    }
		  }
	  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void backup(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; name) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
		      Files.createDirectories(Paths.get(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/Users/chenlingchao/eclipse_projects/workspace/BBI.BugDetection&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
		      ZipOutputStream stream = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ZipOutputStream(
		          Files.newOutputStream(Paths.get(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/Users/chenlingchao/eclipse_projects/workspace/BBI.BugDetection/tmp&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + File.separator + name)));
		      &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
		        backupDir(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/Users/chenlingchao/eclipse_projects/workspace/BBI.BugDetection/tmp&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;meta&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + File.separator + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;tables&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, stream);
		        stream.closeEntry();
		      } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;finally&lt;/span&gt; {
		        stream.close();
		      }
		    }
	  
	  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void restore(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; name) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
		      ZipInputStream stream = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ZipInputStream(
		          Files.newInputStream(Paths.get(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/Users/chenlingchao/eclipse_projects/workspace/BBI.BugDetection/tmp&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + File.separator + name)));
		      &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
		        ZipEntry entry;
		        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt; ((entry = stream.getNextEntry()) != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
		          FileUtils.copyToFile(stream, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/Users/chenlingchao/eclipse_projects/workspace/BBI.BugDetection/tmp&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + File.separator + entry.getName()));
		        }
		      } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;finally&lt;/span&gt; {
		        stream.close();
		      }
		  }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The test code:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
	@Test
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void TestDemo() &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException{
    Demo test = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; Demo();
    test.backup(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;test.zip&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
    test.restore(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;test.zip&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
	}
	
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13239834">IO-609</key>

<item>
            <title>[IO-604] FileUtils.doCopyFile(File, File, boolean) can throw ClosedByInterruptException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-604</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The method &lt;tt&gt;FileUtils.doCopyFile(File, File, boolean)&lt;/tt&gt; can throw &lt;tt&gt;ClosedByInterruptException&lt;/tt&gt; apparently randomly:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;Thread [main] (Suspended (entry into method &amp;lt;init&amp;gt; in ClosedByInterruptException))&#160;&#160;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; owns: Object&#160; (id=405)&#160;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; owns: AbstractComponentSubManager$3&#160; (id=406)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; owns: RunnableLock&#160; (id=407)&#160;&#160;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; ClosedByInterruptException.&amp;lt;init&amp;gt;() line: 51&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; FileChannelImpl(AbstractInterruptibleChannel).end(boolean) line: 202&#160;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; FileChannelImpl.size() line: 315
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; FileUtils.doCopyFile(File, File, boolean) line: 1145&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; FileUtils.copyFile(File, File, boolean) line: 1088&#160;&#160;
&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; FileUtils.copyFile(File, File) line: 1040&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
... Stack frames from my app...
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;I want to workaround this by updating &lt;tt&gt;doCopyFile&lt;/tt&gt; to use Java 7&apos;s &lt;tt&gt;Files.copy(Path,Path,CopyOptions)&lt;/tt&gt; API.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

            <title>[IO-603] Maven dependency version</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-603</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;On &lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-io/dependency-info.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;&quot;Dependency information&quot;&lt;/a&gt;&#160;Maven version is&#160;&lt;b&gt;2.7-SNAPSHOT&lt;/b&gt;, but I have troubles downloading this version, also in &lt;a href=&quot;https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/commons-io/commons-io&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;Maven repository&lt;/a&gt;&#160;it seems the last version is 2.6.&lt;/p&gt;</description>

            <title>[IO-602] listFiles(File directory, IOFileFilter fileFilter, IOFileFilter dirFilter) does not recurse into subdirectories</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-602</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Calling FileUtils.listFiles (someDir, TrueFileFilter.INSTANCE, TrueFileFilter.INSTANCE) will only return top level files.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This contradicts the documentation that says the list should walk the file tree.&lt;/p&gt;</description>

<item>
            <title>[IO-600] getPrefixLength returns wrong length on linux for filename &quot;C:&quot;</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-600</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;On most unix filesystems only null byte and / are reserved characters. So its perfectly valid to have a file called &quot;C:&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If the getPrefixLength method is called for the path of such a file then it returns 2 whereas the expected value is 0.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13215010">IO-600</key>
            <summary>getPrefixLength returns wrong length on linux for filename &quot;C:&quot;</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

@Test
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void testGetPrefixLengthForUnix() {
    assertEquals(0, FilenameUtils.getPrefixLength(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;C:&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
}

<item>
            <title>[IO-597] FileUtils.iterateFiles goes out of memory when executed for a directory with large number of files</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-597</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FileUtils.iterateFiles goes out of memory when executed for a directory with large number of files because it uses the listFiles method which returns an array of java.io.File objects. The iterator itself should not be derived from a list but from a Java Stream which will have lesser memory footprint. This feature however can be used only with Java 8 or later because streams were introduced only in Java 8.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13209174">IO-597</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.iterateFiles goes out of memory when executed for a directory with large number of files</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="arvindvenu">Arvind</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 12 Jan 2019 11:39:25 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 17 Feb 2021 20:03:10 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 17 Feb 2021 20:03:10 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>2.9.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17214739" author="spoor" created="Thu, 15 Oct 2020 14:29:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Whatever solution uses &lt;tt&gt;File.listFiles&lt;/tt&gt; will potentially have the same issue. The iterator could be improved for folders where the files are distributed among several sub folders, but as soon as a folder has a large number of files directly in it, the same problem can arise. This is just a flaw in &lt;tt&gt;File.listFiles&lt;/tt&gt; - it collects files before returning them.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Any proper solution would need to make use of &lt;tt&gt;Files.newDirectoryStream&lt;/tt&gt;. The issue here is that any &lt;tt&gt;DirectoryStream&lt;/tt&gt; needs to be closed. That makes it difficult to implement a single iterator that will recurse into directories.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, is this really needed? There already is a mechanism that creates a &lt;tt&gt;Stream&lt;/tt&gt; over a directory, with nesting: &lt;tt&gt;Files.walk&lt;/tt&gt;. There could be some more wrapper methods that use the parameters of the current &lt;tt&gt;listFiles&lt;/tt&gt; and &lt;tt&gt;iterateFiles&lt;/tt&gt; methods, and that ends with a &lt;tt&gt;map(Path::toFile)&lt;/tt&gt; so it returns a &lt;tt&gt;Stream&amp;lt;File&amp;gt;&lt;/tt&gt; and not a &lt;tt&gt;Stream&amp;lt;Path&amp;gt;&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17214742" author="garydgregory" created="Thu, 15 Oct 2020 14:34:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Some of our &lt;tt&gt;FileUtils&lt;/tt&gt; API can be reimplemented in terms of &lt;tt&gt;Files.walk*&lt;/tt&gt;, even the ones that take instances of&#160;&lt;tt&gt;IOFileFilter&lt;/tt&gt;, see git master.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17215535" author="garydgregory" created="Fri, 16 Oct 2020 17:11:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Note that the current pre-Java 8 implementation of our iterateFiles APIs may feel backward because the underlying API returns a collection of files, and our API that returns an iterator simply iterates over this collection.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;With Java NIO&apos;s Files.walk() APIs we can walk the file tree one element at a time.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But, this is not returning an object where the call site can implement streaming over the elements either which is what an instance of Iterator or better, Stream does.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In order to return a Stream&amp;lt;Path&amp;gt; (or even an Iterator&amp;lt;File&amp;gt;), we need to turn file walking inside out from a the visitor pattern to streaming where the call to get the next item from the stream, &quot;walks&quot; one element &quot;forward&quot; or &quot;down&quot; (for a directory).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This new code can all be NIO based with a bridge to IO as &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=Spoor&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;Spoor&quot;&gt;Rob Spoor&lt;/a&gt;&#160;mentions above.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A problem is that even if we changed the implementation of the current methods to return a File Iterator backed by a DirectoryStream, that stream could not be closed because Iterator does not implement close().&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;My current thinking is that streaming recursively (as opposed to visiting which Files.walk() already does) can only be done with new APIs.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thoughts?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17216281" author="garydgregory" created="Sun, 18 Oct 2020 15:50:12 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=arvindvenu&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;arvindvenu&quot;&gt;Arvind&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please try the current SNAPSHOT build from &lt;a href=&quot;https://repository.apache.org/content/repositories/snapshots&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://repository.apache.org/content/repositories/snapshots&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I re-implemented FileUtils&apos; &lt;b&gt;iterateFiles()&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;iterateFilesAndDirs()&lt;/b&gt;,&#160;&lt;b&gt;listFiles()&lt;/b&gt;, &lt;b&gt;listFilesAndDirs()&lt;/b&gt; to use NIO file tree walking instead of IO file listings.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>
                <customfields>

                            <customfieldvalue>0.0</customfieldvalue>

                            <customfieldvalue>9223372036854775807</customfieldvalue>

                        <customfieldname>Last public comment date</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            47 weeks, 3 days ago
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        <customfield id="customfield_12311820" key="com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-lexo-rank">
                        <customfieldname>Rank</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>0|u00rwg:</customfieldvalue>

                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                <customfield id="customfield_12310920" key="com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-global-rank">

	&lt;li&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils.copy(Reader, Appendable, CharBuffer)&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/li&gt;

<item>
            <title>[IO-593] copyToFile incorrectly closes input stream</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-593</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;h3&gt;&lt;a name=&quot;DescriptionoftheProblem&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;Description of the Problem&lt;/h3&gt;

&lt;p&gt;FileUtils.copyToFile is supposed to &lt;em&gt;not&lt;/em&gt; close the input stream. According to the documentation:&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;The {@code source} stream is left open, e.g. for use with {@link java.util.zip.ZipInputStream ZipInputStream}.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In 2.5 &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/blob/commons-io-2.5/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/io/FileUtils.java#L1551-L1559&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;FileUtils.java:1551-1559&lt;/a&gt; this&#160;was implemented correctly.&#160;In 2.6&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/blob/commons-io-2.6-RC3/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/io/FileUtils.java#L1528-L1531&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;FileUtils.java:1528-1531&lt;/a&gt;&#160;the source stream is used in a try-with-resources block, which incorrectly closes the&#160;input stream at the end of the block.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;hr /&gt;
&lt;h3&gt;&lt;a name=&quot;HowtoReproduce%3F&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;How to Reproduce?&lt;/h3&gt;

&lt;p&gt;We discovered this bug in the following code:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; (JarInputStream jarStream = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; JarInputStream(fileInputStream)) {
  JarEntry entry = jarStream.getNextJarEntry();
  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt; (jarStream.available() != 0) {
    File file = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(directory, entry.getName());

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!entry.isDirectory()) {
      FileUtils.copyToFile(jarStream, file);
    }
    entry = jarStream.getNextJarEntry();
  }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;At some point, jarStream.getNextJarEntry(); throws an exception because the stream is closed:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Stream closed
        at java.util.zip.ZipInputStream.ensureOpen(ZipInputStream.java:67)
        at java.util.zip.ZipInputStream.getNextEntry(ZipInputStream.java:116)
        at java.util.jar.JarInputStream.getNextEntry(JarInputStream.java:142)
        at java.util.jar.JarInputStream.getNextJarEntry(JarInputStream.java:179)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;You may need to read from a sufficiently large JAR to expose the bug.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;hr /&gt;
&lt;h3&gt;&lt;a name=&quot;HowtoFix%3F&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;How to Fix?&lt;/h3&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Fixing this is relatively easy: do not alias `in = source` in the try-with-resources block. Let me know if this bug gets acknowledged, I would be happy to work on a fix.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;macOS 10.14&lt;br/&gt;
java version &quot;1.8.0_121&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_121-b13)&lt;br/&gt;
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.121-b13, mixed mode)&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13202627">IO-593</key>
            <summary>copyToFile incorrectly closes input stream</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="3">Duplicate</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="martijndwars">Martijn Dwars</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 5 Dec 2018 19:39:49 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 5 Dec 2018 20:21:12 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 5 Dec 2018 20:21:12 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.6</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.7</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16710590" author="martijndwars" created="Wed, 5 Dec 2018 20:21:12 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I see this has been fixed in 2.7 (&lt;a href=&quot;https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-554&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-554&lt;/a&gt;).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-591] Tailer has issue if a file is not logged to after rotating the file and second rotation occurs.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-591</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;We are using the org.apache.commons.io.input.Tailer for scrapping logs as another system generates the logs. &#160;Generally, our logs will rotate at midnight each night, sometimes no data will be sent to a log file for more than a day, this is where the problem comes in.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If the Tailer is working on a file and it is rotated, everything works fine unless the file is not written to before the next rotation. &#160;Looking at Tailer.java beginning at line 457, there is a conditional &quot;if (length &amp;gt; position)&quot;... &quot;else if (newer) {&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;anytime the code gets into the &quot;else if (newer) {&quot; block is when this issue will occur.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The issue was noticed in a second hand way, and commented in the file&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;/* ... This can happen if the file is truncated or overwritten... */&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So, in this block, the file has been Rotated, but, there is no place in this block where the RandomAccessFile is re-created with the &apos;new&apos; underlying file.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Anything written into the new file will be noticed because above, the File is used, but, when the code attempts to read from the file, it will never get the data written.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There are multiple ways to fix this, one work around is to set reOpen to true. &#160;Unfortunately, this is not a good workaround for us as the files we are scraping can get very large, seeking to large files every 500ms is not a great way for our production servers to spend their time.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The real fix is to rebuild the RandomAccessFile as it is done beginning on line 437 of the same file. &#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I can make changes and propose them but have never submitted changes for Apache open source and would need some guidance on the process.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13193644">IO-591</key>
            <summary>Tailer has issue if a file is not logged to after rotating the file and second rotation occurs.</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>

                    </labels>

<item>
            <title>[IO-590] Is zero a legal buffer size or not?</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-590</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I notice that in the org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils class, zero is considered as a legal buffer size. For example, the code of toByteArray is as follow:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[] toByteArray(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; InputStream input, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; size) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (size &amp;lt; 0) {
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IllegalArgumentException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Size must be equal or greater than zero: &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + size);
}

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (size == 0) {
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[0];
}
...
}&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The toBufferedReader method does not check buffer sizes.&#160;It pass buffer sizes to the underlying Java API:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; BufferedReader toBufferedReader(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Reader reader, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; size) {
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; reader &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;instanceof&lt;/span&gt; BufferedReader ? (BufferedReader) reader : &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BufferedReader(reader, size);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;However, the underlying API considers zero as an illegal input:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; BufferedReader(Reader in, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; sz) {
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;super&lt;/span&gt;(in);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (sz &amp;lt;= 0)
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IllegalArgumentException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Buffer size &amp;lt;= 0&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;this&lt;/span&gt;.in = in;
cb = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;char&lt;/span&gt;[sz];
nextChar = nChars = 0;
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;I believe that the class shall have the same definition as the underlying API does. Zero shall not be considered as an legal input.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13193075">IO-590</key>
            <summary>Is zero a legal buffer size or not?</summary>

<item>
            <title>[IO-589] Some tests fail if the base path contains a space</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-589</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Some of the IOUtils and FileUtils test cases fail when the base path contains a space.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is because the code uses URL#getFile() or URL#getPath() to convert a file: URL.&lt;br/&gt;
However those methods don&apos;t unencode spaces and other characters that are special to URLs.&lt;br/&gt;
The solution is to use URL#toURI() and pass the URI to the File() constructor.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13192071">IO-589</key>
            <summary>Some tests fail if the base path contains a space</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

<item>
            <title>[IO-586] FileUtils.copyFile fails with java.io.IOException: No such device</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-586</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When trying to copy file on CEPH filesystem, FileUtils.copyFile fails with exception. I don&apos;t see any workaround except of replacing that call and rebuilding the project.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Test Case&lt;/b&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Here&apos;s a simple class to reproduce the issue:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.io.File;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.io.IOException;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.io.PrintWriter;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.nio.file.Files;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;Test3 {
&#160; &#160; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
&#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; PrintWriter writer = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; PrintWriter(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;file.txt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;UTF-8&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
&#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; writer.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;test input &quot;&lt;/span&gt; + &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Math&lt;/span&gt;.random());
&#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; writer.close();
&#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; FileUtils.copyFile(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;file.txt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;), &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;file-copy.txt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;));
&#160; &#160; }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;below is the stacktrace:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Exception in thread &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;main&quot;&lt;/span&gt; java.io.IOException: No such device at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.map0(Native Method) at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.map(FileChannelImpl.java:926) at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.transferFromFileChannel(FileChannelImpl.java:634) at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.transferFrom(FileChannelImpl.java:708) at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.doCopyFile(FileUtils.java:1131) at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.copyFile(FileUtils.java:1076) at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.copyFile(FileUtils.java:1028) at ztst.Test3.main(Test3.java:17)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Here&apos;s our server&apos;s file system configuration:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
1. a squashfs (read only) image stored on a ceph&apos;s rbd
2. a directory on cephfs (read/write)

1 is the lower layer and 2 is the upper layer of an unionfs mount with the following options:

cow
max_files=32768
allow_other
use_ino
direct_io
statfs_omit_ro
nonempty
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-585] FilenameUtils#normalizeNoEndSeparator does not sanitize multiple backslashes directly after the colon in windows file paths</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-585</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FilenameUtils#normalizeNoEndSeparator states in the javadoc that :&lt;br/&gt;
 &quot;A double slash will be merged to a single slash (but UNC names are handled).&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It has been observed that if a double backslash occurs after the colon in a windows filepath, then the&#160;returned path&#160;still contains this double backslash. For example:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
C:\\Program Files\\ExampleDirectory  --&amp;gt;  C:\\Program Files\ExampleDirectory&#160;&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;While the&#160;expectation is that we should be returning &apos; C:\Program Files\ExampleDirectory &apos;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13189156">IO-585</key>
            <summary>FilenameUtils#normalizeNoEndSeparator does not sanitize multiple backslashes directly after the colon in windows file paths</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="adammcclenaghan">Adam McClenaghan</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 3 Oct 2018 13:02:39 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 7 Jun 2021 13:38:04 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 7 Jun 2021 13:37:35 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.6</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.10.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="6000">1h 40m</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16636922" author="adammcclenaghan" created="Wed, 3 Oct 2018 13:09:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Sample code to reproduce:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; path = &quot;C:\\\\Program Files\\\\TestDir;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; normalized = FilenameUtils.normalizeNoEndSeparator(path, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;);&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Observe&#160;that the output is&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
C:\\Program Files\TestDir&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following is a code snippet from&#160;FilenameUtils#doNormalize&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// adjoining slashes
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; i = prefix + 1; i &amp;lt; size; i++) {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (array[i] == separator &amp;amp;&amp;amp; array[i - 1] == separator) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.arraycopy(array, i, array, i - 1, size - i);
        size--;
        i--;
    }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Using the &apos;path&apos; string from the example above, the prefix is set to &apos;3&apos; by FilenameUtils#getPrefixLength, as a result of this, array&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&#160;on first loop will be &apos;P&apos;, this explains why we are not merging the slashes.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17358604" author="garydgregory" created="Mon, 7 Jun 2021 13:37:35 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=adammcclenaghan&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;adammcclenaghan&quot;&gt;Adam McClenaghan&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;PR merged, please verify git master.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;TY!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
