<item>
            <title>[IO-480] IOUtils.closeQuietly can throw NullPointerException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-480</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The IOUtils#closeQuietly method in its javadoc suggests that ANY exceptions will be ignored. This is not the case, as the code only catches IOExceptions. As this example stack trace shows, it is possible for some InputStreams to throw NullPointerExceptions during close:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;java.lang.NullPointerException: null&lt;br/&gt;
	at java.io.FilterInputStream.close(FilterInputStream.java:155) ~&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;na:1.6.0_35&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	at sun.net.www.protocol.jar.JarURLConnection$JarURLInputStream.close(JarURLConnection.java:90) ~&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;na:1.6.0_35&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils.closeQuietly(IOUtils.java:281) ~&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;commons-io-2.1.jar:2.1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils.closeQuietly(IOUtils.java:224) ~&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;commons-io-2.1.jar:2.1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Close quietly should do as advertised/suggested and catch all Exceptions.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12834233">IO-480</key>
            <summary>IOUtils.closeQuietly can throw NullPointerException</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="matthew.kusnierz@gmail.com">Matt Kusnierz</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 1 Jun 2015 13:07:45 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 16 Feb 2017 18:08:09 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 16 Feb 2017 18:08:09 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.4</version>
                                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                    <timeoriginalestimate seconds="600">10m</timeoriginalestimate>
                            <timeestimate seconds="600">10m</timeestimate>
                                        <comments>
                            <comment id="14567280" author="matthew.kusnierz@gmail.com" created="Mon, 1 Jun 2015 13:10:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Also tried with v2.4&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;java.lang.NullPointerException: null&lt;br/&gt;
	at java.io.FilterInputStream.close(FilterInputStream.java:155) ~&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;na:1.6.0_35&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	at sun.net.www.protocol.jar.JarURLConnection$JarURLInputStream.close(JarURLConnection.java:90) ~&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;na:1.6.0_35&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils.closeQuietly(IOUtils.java:303) ~&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;commons-io-2.4.jar:2.4&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
	at org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils.closeQuietly(IOUtils.java:246) ~&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;commons-io-2.4.jar:2.4&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14573794" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 4 Jun 2015 23:29:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;That seems like a bug in the InputStream implementation.&lt;br/&gt;
Does not seem right to catch Exceptions that are not supposed to be thrown by close(), so I suggest closing this as won&apos;t fix&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14577000" author="matthew.kusnierz@gmail.com" created="Mon, 8 Jun 2015 10:32:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have tried to raise this with Oracle through my support companies support contract; and they appear to be reluctant to fix this in the FilterInputStream. The closeQuietly method says that it should silently swallow ANY / all exceptions; so I still think that it makes sense to fix this within IOUtils.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14577732" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 8 Jun 2015 19:51:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I think a better fix might be to correct the Javadoc.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14578580" author="matthew.kusnierz@gmail.com" created="Tue, 9 Jun 2015 08:35:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If the intended use of this method is to perform a best efforts attempt to close the inputStream and not to worry about exceptions; doesn&apos;t it make sense to simply catch Exceptions instead of just IOExceptions. I agree that in this case the NullPointerException should not be thrown in the first place; so the core java FilterInputStream; and/or the JarURLConnectopm$JarUrlInputStream sub-class is at fault; but there could be any number of other poor inputStream implementations out there; and closing them quietly is still the goal of this utility method. Otherwise the user may be forced to re-wrap the call to closeQuietly with another try-catch; which makes closeQuietly redundant.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15380652" author="githubbot" created="Sat, 16 Jul 2016 09:29:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;GitHub user rajivpjs opened a pull request:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/pull/14&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/pull/14&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-480&quot; title=&quot;IOUtils.closeQuietly can throw NullPointerException&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-480&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;IO-480&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; Removed the deprectaed method closeQuietly from the Java doc&#8230;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    As the closeQuietly method has been deprecated, I thought I would use this ticket &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-480&quot; title=&quot;IOUtils.closeQuietly can throw NullPointerException&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-480&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;IO-480&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; to remove the Java documentation.&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[IO-479] Correct exception message in FileUtils.getFile(File, String...)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-479</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Placeholder issue for &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/pull/3&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/pull/3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>

<item>
            <title>[IO-477] Exception on Mac only: Unexpected end of file from server</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-477</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>
&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://stackoverflow.com/q/29853775/1356559&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://stackoverflow.com/q/29853775/1356559&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://qr.ae/L6aYM&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://qr.ae/L6aYM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;I am downloading mp3 and image files using &quot;org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils&quot; in the following code successfully on windows 7: &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    FileUtils.copyURLToFile(new URL(urlString),myFile);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;but on mac os x Yosemite version 10.10.2 (14C1514) I get this exception after few downloads:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;       java.net.SocketException: Unexpected end of file from server&lt;br/&gt;
    at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.parseHTTPHeader(HttpClient.java:792)&lt;br/&gt;
    at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.parseHTTP(HttpClient.java:647)&lt;br/&gt;
    at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.parseHTTPHeader(HttpClient.java:789)&lt;br/&gt;
    at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.parseHTTP(HttpClient.java:647)&lt;br/&gt;
    at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream0(HttpURLConnection.java:1535)&lt;br/&gt;
    at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(HttpURLConnection.java:1440)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I have tried adding a timeout&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    FileUtils.copyURLToFile(new URL(url),myFile ,60000,60000);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;or even using other methods&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    URLConnection conn = new URL(url).openConnection();&lt;br/&gt;
    InputStream is = conn.getInputStream();&lt;br/&gt;
    OutputStream outstream = new FileOutputStream(myFile);&lt;br/&gt;
    byte[] buffer = new byte&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;4096&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
    int len;&lt;br/&gt;
    while ((len = is.read(buffer)) &amp;gt; 0) &lt;/p&gt;
{
        outstream.write(buffer, 0, len);
    }
&lt;p&gt;    outstream.close();&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Update:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I tried to disable WiFi (to avoid any connectivity bugs) and used wired ethernet but still have the same error after few downloads, any help is appreciated.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;mac os x Yosemite version 10.10.2 (14C1514)&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12824068">IO-477</key>

<item>
            <title>[IO-475] FilenameUtils#normalizeNoEndSeparator returns null for UNC prefix without trailing backslash</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-475</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FilenameUtils#normalizeNoEndSeparator returns null for UNC prefix without trailing backslash.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The observed behavior is that normalizeNoEndSeparator returns a non-null value for the following unc-path-prefix:
&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
{serverName-or-IP}\&lt;br/&gt;

{backSlash}{serverName-or-IP}
{backSlash} &lt;br/&gt;
but returns null for the following unc-path-prefix:
&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;{serverName-or-IP}&lt;br/&gt;
{backSlash}
{backSlash}
{serverName-or-IP}

&lt;p&gt;The markdown seems to eat my backslashes prepended to the serverName-or-IP.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There is nothing in the Microsoft API documentation which would suggest that the second unc-path-prefix would be invalid.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Therefore the expectation is that they should be treated as equivalent by FilenameUtils#normalizeNoEndSeparator.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The handling of unc-path-prefix is inconsistent with how FilenameUtils#normalizeNoEndSeparator handles drive relative and drive absolute path prefixes, where each notation is accepted and returns a non-null --&amp;gt; ( C: and C:\ ).&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12819096">IO-475</key>
            <summary>FilenameUtils#normalizeNoEndSeparator returns null for UNC prefix without trailing backslash</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="shoof">Scott Hoof</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>

<item>
            <title>[IO-474]  veracode scan points cross site scripting vulnerability at org/.../commons/io/FileUtils.java 2095. </title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-474</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;We use commons-io-2.4.jar. Recently our veracode scan points cross site scripting vulnerability at org/.../commons/io/FileUtils.java 2095. Do we have a recent version that addresses this issue&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Linux&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12787681">IO-474</key>
            <summary> veracode scan points cross site scripting vulnerability at org/.../commons/io/FileUtils.java 2095. </summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="6">Invalid</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="dananth1">Ananth </reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 2 Apr 2015 13:45:35 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 8 May 2016 22:17:22 +0000</updated>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14394285" author="britter" created="Fri, 3 Apr 2015 10:30:23 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Please provide some more information. What exactly is the problem? How can an attacker exploit Commons IO for an attack. Can you provide a test showing the problem?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14394653" author="b.eckenfels" created="Fri, 3 Apr 2015 16:35:04 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is a FileUtility which allows to write bytes to a file. This can certainly be used wrongly in some conditions, but there is no inheritent security issue in this place. Especially not related to XSS (as you would not use it for web pages anyway).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Besides that, it would be good to do some research before dumping all those veracode false positives into the apache bug tracker :-/ (and 2.4 is recent)&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

                        </customfieldvalues>

<item>
            <title>[IO-472] FileUtils.openOutputStream doesn&apos;t create file if it doesn&apos;t exist</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-472</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The javadoc for this method has a pretty unambiguous statement: &quot;The file will be created if it does not exist.&quot;  However, this isn&apos;t happening.  The code is pretty clear on this:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; FileOutputStream openOutputStream(File file, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; append) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (file.exists()) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (file.isDirectory()) {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IOException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;File &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + file + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&apos;&lt;/span&gt; exists but is a directory&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
            }
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (file.canWrite() == &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;) {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IOException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;File &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + file + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&apos;&lt;/span&gt; cannot be written to&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
            }
        } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt; {
            File parent = file.getParentFile();
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (parent != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!parent.mkdirs() &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !parent.isDirectory()) {
                    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IOException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Directory &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + parent + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&apos;&lt;/span&gt; could not be created&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
                }
            }
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; FileOutputStream(file, append);
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If it doesn&apos;t exist, it will just try to create a FileOutputStream, which throws a FileNotFoundException.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12781878">IO-472</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.openOutputStream doesn&apos;t create file if it doesn&apos;t exist</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="4">Incomplete</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="dkarr">David M. Karr</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 13 Mar 2015 18:04:55 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 23 Apr 2017 18:48:13 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 23 Apr 2017 18:48:13 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.4</version>

                            <comment id="14360872" author="dkarr" created="Fri, 13 Mar 2015 18:28:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The situation might not be exactly as I described.  As I see in the FileOutputStream javadoc, it implies that it will create the file if it doesn&apos;t exist, so this should have worked.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When I run this for my test case, I get the following exception:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;java.io.IOException: The system cannot find the path specified&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;That&apos;s not quite a &quot;FileNotFoundException&quot;.  When I google for this, it appears to refer to the supposed 260 character limit for file paths on Windows.  Curiously, although the path I&apos;m creating is quite long, it&apos;s still short of 260 by 30 or more characters.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I even added code before the call to &quot;openOutputStream&quot; that attempts to create the file if it doesn&apos;t exist, and that&apos;s failing with the same error, so I would conclude that this isn&apos;t a particular problem with FileUtils.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14361476" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sat, 14 Mar 2015 01:40:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Please provide a test case that shows the issue&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-469] &quot;Self-suppression not permitted&quot; while using BrokenOutput and BrokenInput streams with try-with-resource. </title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-469</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi,&lt;br/&gt;
First of all thanks a lot for great library &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I faced with &quot;Self-suppression not permitted&quot; issue while using BrokenInputStream &amp;amp; BrokenOutputStream classes with try-with-resources. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Root cause of this issue is that these classes always throws same exception instance for all methods.&lt;br/&gt;
That&apos;s how it looks like when javac unfolds try-with-resources: &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;        InputStream is = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BrokenInputStream();
        Throwable localThrowable2 = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
            is.read();
        } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (Throwable localThrowable1) {
            localThrowable2 = localThrowable1;
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; localThrowable1;
        } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;finally&lt;/span&gt; {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (is != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (localThrowable2 != &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;) {
                    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
                        is.close();
                    } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (Throwable x2) {
                        localThrowable2.addSuppressed(x2);
                    }
                } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt; {
                    is.close();
                }
            }
        }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;So as you can see when close method is invoked resulting exception will be added to itself (first time thrown during read method), this leads to IllegalArgumentException &quot;Self-suppression not permitted&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It can be easily fixed by omitting throwing of same exception instance for close method. &lt;br/&gt;
If you don&apos;t mind I would attach patch which will fix this issue.  &lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Oracle JVM 1.8_25 (but should be reproducible starting from Java 7).&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12777178">IO-469</key>
            <summary>&quot;Self-suppression not permitted&quot; while using BrokenOutput and BrokenInput streams with try-with-resource. </summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/trivial.svg">Trivial</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="gfadeev">Grigory Fadeev</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 24 Feb 2015 13:42:25 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 19 Jun 2015 17:28:52 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.4</version>
                                                    <component>Streams/Writers</component>
                        <due></due>

<item>
            <title>[IO-467] AbstractFileComparator class is not declared &apos;public&apos;</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-467</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The AbstractFileComparator class in Commons IO 2.4 is not declared &apos;public&apos;, so the sort method is not visible outside its package .&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12770931">IO-467</key>
            <summary>AbstractFileComparator class is not declared &apos;public&apos;</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="6">Invalid</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="lutzreder">Lutz Reder</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 29 Jan 2015 08:00:22 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 29 Jan 2015 13:30:03 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 29 Jan 2015 13:29:43 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.4</version>
                                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14296639" author="britter" created="Thu, 29 Jan 2015 09:38:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;When using subclasses of AbstractFileComparator, I can see the  sort method. Can you give a code example that doesn&apos;t work for you?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14296820" author="lutzreder" created="Thu, 29 Jan 2015 13:18:40 +0000"  >&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;package&lt;/span&gt; myfiles.rename;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.io.File;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.io.IOException;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.io.DirectoryWalker;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.io.comparator.NameFileComparator;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;FileRenamer &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; DirectoryWalker&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; {

    @Override
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;protected&lt;/span&gt; File[] filterDirectoryContents(File directory, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; depth, File[] files) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
        NameFileComparator.NAME_COMPARATOR.sort(files);
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; files;
    }
}

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The error message is &quot;The method sort(File[]) is undefined for the type Comparator&amp;lt;File&amp;gt;&quot;. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14296830" author="britter" created="Thu, 29 Jan 2015 13:29:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The problem is that &lt;tt&gt;NAME_COMPARATOR&lt;/tt&gt; is defined as follows:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Comparator&amp;lt;File&amp;gt; NAME_COMPARATOR = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; NameFileComparator();
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So you&apos;re trying to call sort on a Comparator instance and the Comparator interface does not define the sort method. To make your example work, change your code to:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;package&lt;/span&gt; myfiles.rename;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.io.File;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; java.io.IOException;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.io.DirectoryWalker;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.io.comparator.NameFileComparator;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;FileRenamer &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;extends&lt;/span&gt; DirectoryWalker&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;&amp;gt; {

    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; NameFileComparator COMPARATOR = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; NameFileComparator();

    @Override
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;protected&lt;/span&gt; File[] filterDirectoryContents(File directory, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; depth, File[] files) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
        COMPARATOR.sort(files);
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; files;
    }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                <issuelinks>
                            <issuelinktype id="10030">

        </issuelink>
                            </inwardlinks>
                                    </issuelinktype>
                    </issuelinks>

                    </subtasks>
                <customfields>
                                                                            <customfield id="customfield_12310310" key="com.atlassian.jira.toolkit:attachments">
                        <customfieldname>Attachment count</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>0.0</customfieldvalue>
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        <customfield id="customfield_12310220" key="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate">

<item>
            <title>[IO-466] FileUtils.directoryContains returns wrong response due to startsWith comparison</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-466</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Consider the following:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;File fooDir = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/temp/foo&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
File fooFile = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/temp/foo.txt&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
FileUtils.directoryContains(fooDir, fooFile); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// returns &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;, should &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;fooFile is a sibling of fooDir.  fooDir does not contain fooFile.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is due to the way FilenameUtils.directoryContains is implemented in that this method uses a simple &apos;startsWith&apos; comparison.  A related bug is filed for the FilenameUtils method that I believe should be fixed as well.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12765219">IO-466</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.directoryContains returns wrong response due to startsWith comparison</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="3">Duplicate</resolution>

<item>
            <title>[IO-462] IOExceptionWithCause no longer needed</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-462</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The class IOExceptionWithCause is no longer needed in Java 6, because IOException now includes a constructor that takes a Throwable.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The class should be deprecated and internal usage can revert to using IOException directly.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12759160">IO-462</key>
            <summary>IOExceptionWithCause no longer needed</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 3 Dec 2014 12:48:42 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 8 Nov 2016 17:59:06 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 9 Dec 2014 13:49:43 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.4</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.5</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14232960" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 3 Dec 2014 12:49:50 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;URL: &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/r1642763&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/r1642763&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Log:&lt;br/&gt;
No longer needed in Java 6+&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Modified:&lt;br/&gt;
    commons/proper/io/trunk/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/io/IOExceptionWithCause.java&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;URL: &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/r1642799&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/r1642799&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Log:&lt;br/&gt;
No longer needed in Java 6+&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Modified:&lt;br/&gt;

    commons/proper/io/trunk/src/test/java/org/apache/commons/io/IOExceptionWithCauseTestCase.java&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14232967" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 3 Dec 2014 12:53:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;(0) Good call to deprecate.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;(1) Do we need to worry about breaking the behavior of apps that catch &lt;tt&gt;IOExceptionWithCause&lt;/tt&gt; in a non-major release? &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;(2) It might not even be worth reimplementing &lt;tt&gt;IOExceptionWithCause&lt;/tt&gt; as a &quot;clean&quot; &lt;tt&gt;IOException&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14232971" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 3 Dec 2014 12:59:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;(1) The class was never intended to be caught. If apps raise IOEWC themselves they will still work; it is only internal use of IOEWC that is affected.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;(2) had not thought of that, but it would be tidier. I may fix this, as it&apos;s trivial.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14232974" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 3 Dec 2014 13:01:52 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In retrospect, it might have been better if the class had been designed as a wrapper rather than a subclass.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14239398" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Tue, 9 Dec 2014 13:41:27 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;URL: &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/r1643107&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/r1643107&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Log:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-462&quot; title=&quot;IOExceptionWithCause no longer needed&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-462&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;IO-462&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; IOExceptionWithCause no longer needed&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[IO-461] Veracode scan detected OS command injection vulnerability in commons-io-1.2.jar - FileSystemUtils.java:357</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-461</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Commons IO is embedded in EMC Corporation&apos;s DFS 6.7SP1.&lt;br/&gt;
We performed Veracode scan for DFS 6.7SP1 and scan reported that code in commons-io-1.2.jar - FileSystemUtils.java:357 (no further details) is POSSIBLY vulnerable for OS command injection attacks.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Need update on this from Apache side.&lt;br/&gt;
It it really vulnerable? if yes, is it fixed in some future version?&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12758603">IO-461</key>
            <summary>Veracode scan detected OS command injection vulnerability in commons-io-1.2.jar - FileSystemUtils.java:357</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="arkadeep.kundu@emc.com">Arkadeep Kundu</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 1 Dec 2014 09:57:33 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 8 Nov 2016 18:04:30 +0000</updated>

                                    <version>1.2</version>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14229663" author="joehni" created="Mon, 1 Dec 2014 11:11:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Why do you expect any reaction, if you report probable vulnerabilities for ancient versions of this component? Version 1.2 was released 8 years ago. So please do us all a favor and run your tests against a current release and report back, if you found something there.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14230067" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 1 Dec 2014 17:24:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Agreed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If the tool shows a problem with the current version of IO (2.4) then please re-open the issue with sufficient details to be able to investigate it.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14378520" author="b.eckenfels" created="Tue, 24 Mar 2015 20:25:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Just for the record, openProcessStream(String[] params) forwards the String array 1:1 to Runtime.getRuntime().exec(params), so this API is as dangerous or not dangerous to use like the normal system class. Iff there is a vulnerability then it is in the application code. (there are executor frameworks which are doing much more wrong &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt; &lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-460] Tailer should not seek to the last line in case if file was just created</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-460</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If Tailer did could not open file on its first attempt - it means the file did not exist yet hence when the file finally appears it must not be seeked to the end even if the `end` argument is set.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Otherwise the lines that are added withing waiting timeout are not captured by Tailer.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I find this behaviour wrong, since if a file did not exist on a moment of running Tailer thread - then it must capture every line from the beginning.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thoughts?&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12754093">IO-460</key>
            <summary>Tailer should not seek to the last line in case if file was just created</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[IO-453] Regression in FileUtils.readFileToString from 2.0.1</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-453</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FileUtils.readFileToString has changed it&apos;s behavior to make a call from &lt;tt&gt;IOUtils.toByteArray(in)&lt;/tt&gt; to &lt;tt&gt;IOUtils.toByteArray(in, file.length())&lt;/tt&gt; in &lt;tt&gt;FileUtils.readFileToString&lt;/tt&gt;. This is a regression because if the file.length = 0, then it will return 0. According to the javadocs for &lt;a href=&quot;http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/io/File.html#length()&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;File#length&lt;/a&gt;, it is possible to return 0 if it is a System dependent entities, so even though the File.length might return 0, the stream is still open and  &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Steps to reproduce (Ubuntu):&lt;br/&gt;
1. Execute &lt;tt&gt;nohup sleep 10000 &amp;amp;&lt;/tt&gt; in a terminal, and get the process id of the sleep command (&lt;tt&gt;ps -ef | grep sleep&lt;/tt&gt;).&lt;br/&gt;
2. Call &lt;tt&gt;FileUtils.readFileToString(new File(&quot;/proc/$PID/environ&quot;));&lt;/tt&gt; where $PID is the process ID from step 1.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You will notice that in 2.0.1 it returns several elements, however in 2.1 it will return nothing.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;See &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ndeloof&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ndeloof&quot;&gt;nicolas de loof&lt;/a&gt;&apos;s comment in &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/commit/53a40a6d9dcaaa616b404255406edc30fe2d524c&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-io/commit/53a40a6d9dcaaa616b404255406edc30fe2d524c&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12728035">IO-453</key>
            <summary>Regression in FileUtils.readFileToString from 2.0.1</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="schristou88">Steven Christou</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 17 Jul 2014 20:43:34 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 8 Nov 2016 17:59:01 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 30 Jul 2014 23:21:07 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.1</version>
                    <version>2.2</version>
                    <version>2.3</version>
                    <version>2.4</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.5</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>

                            <comment id="14080175" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 30 Jul 2014 23:21:07 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;URL: &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/r1614791&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/r1614791&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[IO-451] ant test fails - resources missing from test classpath</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-451</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;ant test does not copy test resources to target/ and does not include test resources in test class path.&lt;br/&gt;
maven test is ok.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Example failure:&lt;br/&gt;
----------------------------------------------&lt;br/&gt;
someguy@weeble:~/prog/java/commons-io/commons-io$ ant clean&lt;br/&gt;
Buildfile: /home/someguy/prog/java/commons-io/commons-io/build.xml&lt;br/&gt;
 .&lt;br/&gt;
 .&lt;br/&gt;
 .&lt;br/&gt;
BUILD SUCCESSFUL&lt;br/&gt;
Total time: 0 seconds&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;someguy@weeble:~/prog/java/commons-io/commons-io$ ant test&lt;br/&gt;
Buildfile: /home/someguy/prog/java/commons-io/commons-io/build.xml&lt;br/&gt;
 .&lt;br/&gt;
 .&lt;br/&gt;
 .&lt;br/&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;junit&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; Running org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsListFilesTestCase&lt;br/&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;junit&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; Tests run: 3, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.064 sec&lt;br/&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;junit&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; Running org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsTestCase&lt;br/&gt;
    &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;junit&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; Tests run: 20, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.087 sec&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;BUILD FAILED&lt;br/&gt;
/home/someguy/prog/java/commons-io/commons-io/build.xml:192: Test org.apache.commons.io.FileUtilsTestCase failed&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Total time: 32 seconds&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[IO-450] File doesn&apos;t end with blank line and cann&apos;t get the last line using Tailer!</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-450</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I use Tailer to read file, I can&apos;t get the last line if the file doesn&apos;t end with a blank line!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;My file like as following:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;AAAAAAAAAAAA&lt;br/&gt;
BBBBBBBBBBBB&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And Not end with a blank line, &quot;BBBBBBBBBBBB&quot; is the last line, When I use io.input.Tailer to tail the file, I cann&apos;t get the last line &quot;BBBBBBBBBBBB&quot;!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;All  versions(2.3/2.4/2.5) of Commons-IO have the same problem! &lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;linux and windows 7&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12725431">IO-450</key>
            <summary>File doesn&apos;t end with blank line and cann&apos;t get the last line using Tailer!</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="davidchiu">davidchiu</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 4 Jul 2014 07:56:59 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 22 Nov 2015 07:44:48 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.4</version>
                                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14076054" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 28 Jul 2014 09:50:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Sounds like the file does not have a trailing EOL.&lt;br/&gt;
Since Tailer reads complete lines, it won&apos;t see the last (incomplete) line.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m not sure there is any way around this without breaking existing functionality.&lt;br/&gt;
How can Tailer know when the last line is complete if it does not have an EOL?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14551178" author="britter" created="Tue, 19 May 2015 20:37:15 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The documentation says &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;blockquote&gt;&lt;p&gt;Simple implementation of the unix &quot;tail -f&quot; functionality.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;

&lt;p&gt;How does &lt;tt&gt;tail -f&lt;/tt&gt; behave in the case of a missing EOL in the last line? Tailer should behave the same way IMHO.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14556021" author="britter" created="Fri, 22 May 2015 11:53:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The problem is, that tail is stream based but Tailer is line based. So the comparison doesn&apos;t work out completely. If I have a file with the following content:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;AAAAAAA\n
BBBBBBB
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And I do a &lt;tt&gt;tail -f&lt;/tt&gt; on the file, I&apos;ll get the following output:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;$: tail -f file.txt
AAAAAAA
BBBBBBB
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It simply waits for new input on the last line. That could be an EOL or it could be EOF. Tailer OTOH currently detects lines based on the EOL character. I agree that lines without EOF at EOF should also be handled. A simple solution would be to call &lt;tt&gt;listener.handle(new String(lineBuf.toByteArray(), cset))&lt;/tt&gt; after the while-loop in &lt;tt&gt;readLines(final RandomAccessFile reader)&lt;/tt&gt; if the &lt;tt&gt;lineBuf&lt;/tt&gt; stil has content.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

                    </attachments>

<item>
            <title>[IO-449] FileUtils.sizeOfDirectory(File) throws IllegalArgumentException on symlink that does not exist</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-449</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FileUtils.isSymlink(File) will throw an IllegalArgumentException if the symbolic link does not exist. FileUtils.sizeOfDirectory(File) ignores any exceptions that are from the symbolic link. I added another catch to ignore IllegalArgumentException.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12724028">IO-449</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.sizeOfDirectory(File) throws IllegalArgumentException on symlink that does not exist</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="schristou88">Steven Christou</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 27 Jun 2014 01:08:09 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 21 Feb 2020 09:29:41 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.5</version>
                                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>5</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14045407" author="schristou88" created="Fri, 27 Jun 2014 01:13:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have created a patch for this issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14048240" author="kinow" created="Mon, 30 Jun 2014 22:18:14 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Patch looks good and doesn&apos;t break any existing tests cases.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14706797" author="risenberg" created="Fri, 21 Aug 2015 14:31:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;When shall this fix appear in a release?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14978025" author="almson" created="Wed, 28 Oct 2015 09:13:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m not sure the explanation and comment is correct. This isn&apos;t about symlinks, and I don&apos;t think `isSymlink` throws IllegalArgumentException.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This fixes a race condition when the directory is being modified as its size is being calculated.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This also underlines a problem with FileUtils.sizeOf(File). It shouldn&apos;t throw `IllegalArgumentException`, it should throw a checked `IOException` when the file isn&apos;t found because the caller can&apos;t prevent the exception and he should be reminded to check for it.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14978087" author="risenberg" created="Wed, 28 Oct 2015 09:48:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;There is a problem with symlinks, though it is not correctly described - isSymlink() returns false for broken symlinks and then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown by sizeOf.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17041704" author="znep666" created="Fri, 21 Feb 2020 09:29:41 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I ran into the same issue. Thanks a lot Steven for the patch, saved me a lot of time! Will this be included in one of the next releases?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[IO-448] FileUtils.waitFor(...) swallows thread interrupted status</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-448</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The method waits for a file to appear for a given amount of time. To do so it calls Thread.sleep several times. If the thread is interrupted, the interrupt will be ignored by catching the ThreadInterrupted exception and waiting further.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Catching the ThreadInterrupted exception automatically clears the thread&apos;s interrupted flag. Consequently the calling method has no chance to detect whether the thread was interrupted. A possible solution is to restore the interrupted status before returning - something like this:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; waitFor(File file, &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; seconds) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; timeout = 0;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; tick = 0;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; wasInterrupted = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt; (!file.exists()) {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// ...
&lt;/span&gt;                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
                    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Thread&lt;/span&gt;.sleep(100);
                } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (InterruptedException ignore) {
                    wasInterrupted = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;;
                } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (Exception ex) {
                    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;break&lt;/span&gt;;
                }
            }
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;;
        } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;finally&lt;/span&gt; {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (wasInterrupted) {
                   &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;Thread&lt;/span&gt;.currentThread.interrupt();
            }
        }
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12721240">IO-448</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.waitFor(...) swallows thread interrupted status</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="krosenvold">Kristian Rosenvold</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="OydvO">Bj&#246;rn Buchner</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 14 Jun 2014 08:37:58 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 23 Jun 2015 05:58:58 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 23 Jun 2015 05:58:58 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.4</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.5</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14593743" author="krosenvold" created="Fri, 19 Jun 2015 18:24:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in r1686477, thanks for the patch !&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>

<item>
            <title>[IO-447] Possible NPE in FileSystemUtils.freeSpaceWindows; FilenameUtils.normalize can return null</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-447</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;There is a possible NPE in FileSystemUtils.freeSpaceWindows.&lt;br/&gt;
FilenameUtils.normalize can return null so the path.length() will NPE&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example, &quot;..&quot; returns null.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;m not entirely sure why the path needs to be normalised, apart from converting / to \. Even that seems a bit dubious - why should the user want to return the freespace for a Unix-style path on a Windows system?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And if it does need to be normalised, why not use the File class, which handles / to \ conversion transparently?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A short term fix would be to return IAE for paths that normalise to null.&lt;br/&gt;
However that would not allow the use of paths such as &quot;..&quot; - though at least that would not cause NPE.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12718260">IO-447</key>
            <summary>Possible NPE in FileSystemUtils.freeSpaceWindows; FilenameUtils.normalize can return null</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 3 Jun 2014 22:12:22 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 23 Apr 2017 15:12:45 +0000</updated>
                                                                                <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>

<item>
            <title>[IO-445] attributes are missing in MANIFEST.MF</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-445</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;We are encountering an issue using commons-io-2.4.jar inside an applet.&lt;br/&gt;
Since the 7U45 of java, the MANIFEST of a jar used inside an applet must be complete.&lt;br/&gt;
3 attributes are missing in the MANIFEST&lt;br/&gt;
Trusted-Library : true&lt;br/&gt;
Application-Name : &amp;lt;&amp;lt;as you want&amp;gt;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Permissions : all-permissions (or less if you want to be precise)&lt;br/&gt;
Codebase : *&lt;br/&gt;
see : &lt;a href=&quot;http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/jweb/security/manifest.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/jweb/security/manifest.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Without these attributes, the JRE refuse to execute an applet containing commons-io-2.4.jar.&lt;br/&gt;
Could you please fix that in order to make these two jars usable inside an applet ?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12715184">IO-445</key>
            <summary>attributes are missing in MANIFEST.MF</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="2" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg">Critical</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="yjfJeff">Jeff Yu</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 19 May 2014 14:39:19 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 7 Jun 2014 16:24:26 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 7 Jun 2014 16:24:20 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.4</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14017662" author="yjfjeff" created="Wed, 4 Jun 2014 12:43:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi there,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When can this issue be planed to get fixed?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14017674" author="garydgregory" created="Wed, 4 Jun 2014 12:59:56 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I wonder if this is something we could/should implement in commons-parent.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14017883" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 4 Jun 2014 17:15:31 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;We could of course add this to the parent pom, but won&apos;t this bypass any security checks in the browser?&lt;br/&gt;
Is that something we want to do? Should we not perform some kind of security analysis first?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The &quot;Application Name&quot; field looks safe enough to add (though it is optional anyway). I&apos;m not sure about the rest.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;According to the linked article, Codebase cannot be &quot;*&quot;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;An asterisk &amp;#40;*) can be used as a wildcard only at the beginning of the domain name, and cannot be used with only a top-level domain, such as *.com. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So I don&apos;t see how we can possibly provide a Codebase that works for all users.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I suspect these values need to be set up by the person who wants to use the jar.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14018181" author="joehni" created="Wed, 4 Jun 2014 21:04:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;See my comments at &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CODEC-186&quot; title=&quot;attributes are missing in MANIFEST.MF&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;CODEC-186&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;CODEC-186&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-443] FileUtils.copyFile methods throw an unnecessary &quot;Failed to copy full contents from&quot; exception </title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-443</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The private doCopyFile method of FileUtils does a comparison between the source and destination file sizes after the data has been copied. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If the destination file has been removed, renamed, or otherwise no more accessible (remote share no more available) between the finally block and the size comparison the destFile.length() returns zero. If the source file is not zero bytes in size an exception with the message &quot;Failed to copy full contents from &apos;&quot; + srcFile + &quot;&apos; to &apos;&quot; + destFile &quot; will be thrown.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Regards&lt;br/&gt;
Sami&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Win x86  32 bit&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12714251">IO-443</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.copyFile methods throw an unnecessary &quot;Failed to copy full contents from&quot; exception </summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="oerlybird">Sami Nieminen</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 14 May 2014 19:20:55 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 11 Dec 2017 11:31:06 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.4</version>
                                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16285795" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 11 Dec 2017 11:29:05 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;If the output size were checked before the file is closed but after it is flushed, that should catch actual copy errors (assuming the input does not change) regardless of subsequent changes to the destination.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think the question here is: what is the check really for?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
