<item>
            <title>[IO-442] Javadoc contradictory for FileFilterUtils.ageFileFilter(cutoff) and the filter it constructs: AgeFileFilter(cutoff)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-442</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Documentation states that it returns true if the file is &lt;b&gt;after&lt;/b&gt; cutoff... but the code does opposite!&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    /**
     * Returns a filter that returns &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; the file was last modified after
     * the specified cutoff time.
     */
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;BUT..the code constructs the following:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; IOFileFilter ageFileFilter(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; cutoff) {
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; AgeFileFilter(cutoff);
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;And the Javadoc for this AgeFileFilter says...OLDER i.e. before&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    /**
     * Constructs a &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; age file filter &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; files equal to or older than
     * a certain cutoff
     *
     * @param cutoff  the threshold age of the files
     */
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Which is it?!&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12711957">IO-442</key>
            <summary>Javadoc contradictory for FileFilterUtils.ageFileFilter(cutoff) and the filter it constructs: AgeFileFilter(cutoff)</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/trivial.svg">Trivial</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="pascalschumacher">Pascal Schumacher</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="roninsos">Simon Robinson</reporter>

                    </labels>

            <title>[IO-439] FileAlterationObserver should check whether inputFile is a directory</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-439</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;A FileAlterationObserver class receives a String/File object indicating directory and checks whether this file has changed. It doesn&apos;t work if file isn&apos;t a directory but no warnings/errors are being thrown.&lt;br/&gt;
I think there should be a check if a given input is a directory.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Unix, Ubuntu 64&lt;/p&gt;</environment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-438] IOUtils.closeQuietly Javadoc needs fixing</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-438</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;As mentioned in a comment on &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-388&quot; title=&quot;CloseAllQuietly Method&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-388&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;IO-388&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, there is a danger that closeQuietly is used inappropriately.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Indeed the &quot;Closing all streams:&quot; examples in the Javadoc for various closeQuietly methods are wrong.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The IOUtils.copy() methods don&apos;t close their input and output parameters.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It is arguably OK to ignore exceptions when closing the input, but it is a bad idea to ignore exceptions when closing the output, as that could mean that the output has not been fully written.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The Javadoc for these examples could be dropped, but I think it would be better to fix it to show how it should be done properly.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There are a lot of copies of the bad example; I suggest we agree on a sample replacement before updating them all.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12708085">IO-438</key>
            <summary>IOUtils.closeQuietly Javadoc needs fixing</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>

<item>
            <title>[IO-436] Improper JavaDoc comment for FilenameUtils.indexOfExtension</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-436</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The method FilenameUtils.indexOfExtension contains this JavaDoc comment:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;  &amp;#42; @param filename  the filename to find the last path separator in, null returns -1&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;#42; @return the index of the last separator character, or -1 if there&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;#42; is no such character&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This comment was obviously copied from the FilenameUtils.indexOfLastSeparator method, where it makes perfect sense.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The JavaDoc comment for FilenameUtils.indexOfExtension should rather read e.g. as follows:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;  &amp;#42; @param filename  the filename to find the last extension separator in, null returns -1&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;#42; @return the index of the last extension separator character, or -1 if there&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;#42; is no such character&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12707694">IO-436</key>

<item>
            <title>[IO-430] IOUtils.copy(IS, Writer) implementation and javadoc disagrees</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-430</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The Javadoc of the (deprecated) IOUtils.copy(InputStream,Writer) states:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;  * This method uses {@link InputStreamReader}.
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;but the actual code does not:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    @Deprecated
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void copy(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; InputStream input, &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; Writer output)
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
        copy(input, output, Charset.defaultCharset());
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;My suggestion would be to change the javadoc to state &quot;@link copy(InputStream, Writer, Charset)} with @&lt;/p&gt;
{code Charset.defaultCharset()}
&lt;p&gt;&quot;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12701099">IO-430</key>
            <summary>IOUtils.copy(IS, Writer) implementation and javadoc disagrees</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="6">Invalid</resolution>

<item>
            <title>[IO-429] ByteArrayOutputStream can overflow</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-429</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;There are many places involved in the problem, and a good fix might be problematic performance wise.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example:&lt;br/&gt;
IOUtils.toByteArray(InputStream input) invoked with a Stream which feeds more than Integer.MAX_VALUE bytes will either crash with NegativeArraySizeException or maybe worse overflow in such a way that it returns fine (but only with partial data)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The ByteArrayOutputStream will happily consume the full stream but &quot;int count&quot; will overflow. At some point then toByteArray is invoked which will do like new byte&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;count&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;maybe &quot;needNewBuffer&quot; can throw the IllegalArgumentException, as it gets  the count and could check for the overflow.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12700981">IO-429</key>
            <summary>ByteArrayOutputStream can overflow</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="fabianlange">Fabian Lange</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 12 Mar 2014 14:40:18 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 17 May 2021 18:29:48 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 16 May 2021 15:23:02 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>2.9.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>4</watches>
                                            <timeestimate seconds="0">0h</timeestimate>
                            <timespent seconds="12000">3h 20m</timespent>
                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13932340" author="b.eckenfels" created="Wed, 12 Mar 2014 20:44:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The current code is nicely reusing ByteArrayOutputStream as well as largeCopy() from IOUtils. There would be the option to implement it much more directly (using a gatherlist approach and size limited buffers), which would have a number of advantages:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;reduced array copies (each byte at most once)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;controlled array resizing (for example 2 step linear growth)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;flatter stacks&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;using some available() hints&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;But the code would be more complicated. Something like (pseudocode):&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;minsize=4k;
normsize=1M;
offset=0;
buf = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[minsize];
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt;(hasRoom(buf,offfset)
  c = in.read(buf,offset,bug.length-offset);
  read += c;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (eof) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; Arrays.copy(buf,read);
gatherlist = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ArrayList&amp;lt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[])(); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// max 2047 1mb fragments
&lt;/span&gt;gatherlist.add(buf);
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt;(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;) {
  buf= &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[normsize]; 
  c = in.readFully(buf);
  read+=c;
  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; read &amp;gt; MAX_INT
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt;();
  &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (eof) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; arrayFrom(gatherlist, buf);
  gatherlist.add(buf);
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If you think it is worth to have this kind of optimized implementation I can provide a working version. It is not only good for large streams, but will also reduce the allocations for short ones. (copyLarge() has one buffer, ArrayOutputStream has a internal and returned one).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But actually ByteBuffer would be much nicer as a return type.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17345733" author="garydgregory" created="Sun, 16 May 2021 15:23:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;In git master.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-428] BOMInputStream.skip returns wrong count if stream contains no BOM</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-428</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If the &lt;tt&gt;skip&lt;/tt&gt; method of &lt;tt&gt;BOMInputStream&lt;/tt&gt; is used on a stream without a BOM, &lt;tt&gt;skip&lt;/tt&gt; returns the wrong number of bytes (n - max(BOM-length)). This can lead to problems if the return value is evaluated for example from guava &lt;tt&gt;ByteStreams.skipFully&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;BomTest.java&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;BomTest {

	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; InputStream createInputStream(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; addBOM) {
		ByteBuffer bb = ByteBuffer.allocate(64);
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (addBOM) {
			&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// UTF-8 BOM
&lt;/span&gt;			bb.put(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;[] { (&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;) 0xEF, (&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;) 0xBB, (&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;) 0xBF });
		}
		bb.put((&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;) 0x31);
		bb.put((&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;) 0x32);
		bb.put((&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;) 0x33);
		&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; ByteArrayInputStream(bb.array());
	}
	
	&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
		BOMInputStream is1 = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BOMInputStream(createInputStream(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;));
		assertEquals(2, is1.skip(2));
		assertEquals((&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;) 0x33, is1.read());
		
		BOMInputStream is2 = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BOMInputStream(createInputStream(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;));
		assertEquals(2, is2.skip(2)); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// fails here - skip returns 0
&lt;/span&gt;		assertEquals((&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;byte&lt;/span&gt;) 0x33, is2.read());
	}
	
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I catched this bug in 2.0.1, but as far as I can see on the source 2.5 is still affected.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I suggest the following change to the &lt;tt&gt;skip&lt;/tt&gt; method:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;BOMInputStream.java&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; skip(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; n) &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throws&lt;/span&gt; IOException {
    	&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;int&lt;/span&gt; skipped = 0;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;while&lt;/span&gt; ((n &amp;gt; skipped) &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (readFirstBytes() &amp;gt;= 0)) {
            skipped++;
        }
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; in.skip(n - skipped) + skipped;
    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-423] FilenameUtils.directoryContains assumes separator at end of parent path</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-423</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FilenameUtils.directoryContains(&quot;/abc&quot;, &quot;/abcd&quot;) returns true, while FilenameUtils.directoryContains(&quot;/abc/&quot;, &quot;/abcd&quot;) returns false.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The implementation does a simple checkStartsWith() without taking the separator into consideration.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12692402">IO-423</key>
            <summary>FilenameUtils.directoryContains assumes separator at end of parent path</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>

                            <comment id="14064143" author="tn" created="Wed, 16 Jul 2014 21:35:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The javadoc of the method states that the input needs to be normalized, i.e. the canonical path of the respective file resource. A canonical path does not have a &apos;/&apos; at the end.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14248829" author="rnavarette" created="Tue, 16 Dec 2014 20:12:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Unfortunately though this same issue surfaces when calling FileUtils.directoryContains(File parent, File child).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also, I&apos;m not certain what the above comment implies.  The docs do in fact mention the paths needing to be normalized, but even using the FilenameUtils.normalize(String path) method on the initial example here would show the same wrong behavior.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-420] Detection of deleted directories fails if the directory does not exist when the observer is created.</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-420</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If a directory is observed, that doesn&apos;t exist when the observer is created, no deletion event will be created, when this directory is deleted again.&lt;br/&gt;
Use case: mounting/unmounting of usb devices&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12687883">IO-420</key>
            <summary>Detection of deleted directories fails if the directory does not exist when the observer is created.</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="joepacde">Joerg Pacher</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 8 Jan 2014 15:46:14 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 8 Jan 2014 15:48:29 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.4</version>
                                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13865568" author="joepacde" created="Wed, 8 Jan 2014 15:48:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Issue is solved when changing FileAlterationOberserver.checkAndNotify to:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;		if (rootFile.exists()) &lt;/p&gt;
{
			rootEntry.setExists(true);
			checkAndNotify(rootEntry, rootEntry.getChildren(),
					listFiles(rootFile));
		}
&lt;p&gt; else if (rootEntry.isExists()) &lt;/p&gt;
{
			rootEntry.setExists(false);
			checkAndNotify(rootEntry, rootEntry.getChildren(),
					FileUtils.EMPTY_FILE_ARRAY);
		}
&lt;p&gt; else &lt;/p&gt;
{
			// Didn&apos;t exist and still doesn&apos;t
		}</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-414] IOUtils.writeLines is not correct with a charset with BOM</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-414</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;When a charset has a BOM (like UTF-16), the method IOUtils.writeLines put 2 BOM on each line.&lt;/p&gt;
</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12683335">IO-414</key>
            <summary>IOUtils.writeLines is not correct with a charset with BOM</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="florent.brosse">Florent Brosse</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 8 Dec 2013 16:36:19 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 8 Dec 2013 16:43:07 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>2.4</version>
                    <version>2.5</version>
                                                    <component>Streams/Writers</component>
                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13842551" author="florent.brosse" created="Sun, 8 Dec 2013 16:40:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I suggest that code to correct that bug:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;    public static void writeLines(final Collection&amp;lt;?&amp;gt; lines, String lineEnding, final OutputStream output, final Charset encoding)&lt;br/&gt;
            throws IOException {&lt;br/&gt;
        if (lines == null) &lt;/p&gt;
{
            return;
        }&lt;br/&gt;
        if (lineEnding == null) {
            lineEnding = LINE_SEPARATOR;
        }&lt;br/&gt;
        final Charset cs = Charsets.toCharset(encoding);&lt;br/&gt;
        StringBuilder stringBuilder = new StringBuilder();&lt;br/&gt;
        for (final Object line : lines) {&lt;br/&gt;
            if (line != null) {
            	stringBuilder.append(line.toString());
            }&lt;br/&gt;
            stringBuilder.append(lineEnding);&lt;br/&gt;
        }&lt;br/&gt;
        output.write(stringBuilder.toString().getBytes(cs));&lt;br/&gt;
    }&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;br/&gt;
 public static void writeLines(final Collection&amp;lt;?&amp;gt; lines, String lineEnding,&lt;br/&gt;
            final Writer writer) throws IOException {&lt;br/&gt;
        if (lines == null) {            return;        }
&lt;p&gt;        if (lineEnding == null) &lt;/p&gt;
{
            lineEnding = LINE_SEPARATOR;
        }
&lt;p&gt;        StringBuilder stringBuilder = new StringBuilder();&lt;br/&gt;
        for (final Object line : lines) {&lt;br/&gt;
            if (line != null) &lt;/p&gt;
{
            	stringBuilder.append(line.toString());
            }
&lt;p&gt;            stringBuilder.append(lineEnding);&lt;br/&gt;
        }&lt;br/&gt;
        writer.write(stringBuilder.toString());&lt;br/&gt;
    }&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[IO-411] moveFile throws Exception prematurely?</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-411</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;This may not be an issue, but I noticed that the moveFile command throws an exception after trying and ignoring the return value of deleteQuietly. Look at line 2969 below.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Taken from SVN head:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;2965         &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;boolean&lt;/span&gt; rename = srcFile.renameTo(destFile);
2966	        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!rename) {
2967	            copyFile( srcFile, destFile );
2968	            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!srcFile.delete()) {
2969	                FileUtils.deleteQuietly(destFile);
2970	                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; IOException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Failed to delete original file &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&quot;&lt;/span&gt; srcFile + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&apos;&lt;/span&gt; after copy to &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&apos;&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + destFile + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;&apos;&lt;/span&gt;&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
2972	            }
2973	        }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;deleteQuietly will just end up trying File.delete() again which will likely fail at that point, but still, shouldn&apos;t there be another if statement there?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note: Haven&apos;t actually had issues with this.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12681132">IO-411</key>
            <summary>moveFile throws Exception prematurely?</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="6">Invalid</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="nearwood">Nick</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 25 Nov 2013 21:18:34 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 23 Apr 2017 18:23:45 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 23 Apr 2017 18:23:45 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.4</version>
                                                    <component>Utilities</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15980497" author="pascalschumacher" created="Sun, 23 Apr 2017 18:23:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Nick,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;thanks for reporting.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The implementation is correct. FilesUtils.deleteQuietly is called with the destination file (not the source file).&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>
                <customfields>
                                                                            <customfield id="customfield_12310310" key="com.atlassian.jira.toolkit:attachments">
                        <customfieldname>Attachment count</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>0.0</customfieldvalue>
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        <customfield id="customfield_12310220" key="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:firstresponsedate">
                        <customfieldname>Date of First Response</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            <customfieldvalue>Sun, 23 Apr 2017 18:23:45 +0000</customfieldvalue>

                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>
                                                                <customfield id="customfield_12314020" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin:devsummary">
                        <customfieldname>Development</customfieldname>
                        <customfieldvalues>
                            
                        </customfieldvalues>
                    </customfield>

<item>
            <title>[IO-401] [IO] copyFileToDirectory - Over-Write File</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-401</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I came across a small annoyance at work today.  I have code that takes a file and copies it to a mounted directory on a remote server.  I am using FileUtils.copyFileToDirectory() to do the move, but it does not have an overwrite flag.  If something goes wrong with the file transfer over the network, and only part of the file is transferred, all subsequent attempts are blocked by the fact that the file &quot;already exists.&quot;  I would like to see another overloaded copyFileToDirectory() method with a flag to overwrite the file if it already exists.  The current behavior is to throw an IoException.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks!&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12675593">IO-401</key>
            <summary>[IO] copyFileToDirectory - Over-Write File</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>

<item>
            <title>[IO-399] Tailer does not handle log file rotation properly if reOpen is true</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-399</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If the reOpen option is true, the Tailer can currently fail with FileNotFoundException if a logger renames or deletes an existing file and does not replace it before the Tailer tries to reopen it following the wait period.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In the case of Windows, the delete/rename can only occur during the wait period as the file is locked otherwise, but for other OSes the delete/rename may occur whilst the tailer still has the file open; as far as I can tell, that case is catered for.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The Tailer should report FileNotFound and wait for the file to reappear.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12668291">IO-399</key>
            <summary>Tailer does not handle log file rotation properly if reOpen is true</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 12 Sep 2013 15:50:22 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 23 Apr 2017 09:34:15 +0000</updated>
                                                                                <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>

Curious why it didn&apos;t draw any attention &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/sad.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14204674" author="zerkms" created="Mon, 10 Nov 2014 11:44:37 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Btw, created a quick fix for this issue: &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/zerkms/commons-io/compare/IO399-handling-reopen&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/zerkms/commons-io/compare/IO399-handling-reopen&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[IO-398] listener.fileRotated() will be invoked more than one time in a real rotate activity</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-398</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;       When Tailer considers file rotation is occurred, listener.fileRotated() will be execute, and file will re-open by &quot;reader = new RandomAccessFile(file, RAF_MODE);&quot;. However, the new file may not be created yet, FileNotFoundException would be caught and while loop would be executed again and again until the new file is actually created, which cause listener.fileRotated() triggered repeatedly. &lt;br/&gt;
This is the piece of code causing the problem:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt; 
while (getRun()) {
    final boolean newer = isFileNewer(file, last); // IO-279, must be done first
    // Check the file length to see if it was rotated
    final long length = file.length();
    if (length &amp;lt; position) {
        // File was rotated
        listener.fileRotated();
        // Reopen the reader after rotation
        try {
            // Ensure that the old file is closed iff we re-open it successfully
            final RandomAccessFile save = reader;
            reader = new RandomAccessFile(file, RAF_MODE);
            /* some code */
        } catch (final FileNotFoundException e) {
            // in this case we continue to use the previous reader and position values
            listener.fileNotFound();
        }
        continue;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;      While condition checkes can be deployed in listener.fileRotated() to correct the sematic of fileRotate, it is better to prevent multiple invocation of listener.fileRotated() on this issue.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12667999">IO-398</key>
            <summary>listener.fileRotated() will be invoked more than one time in a real rotate activity</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="3">Duplicate</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="cltlfcjin">Lantao Jin</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 11 Sep 2013 07:36:39 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 23 Apr 2017 09:37:44 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 23 Apr 2017 09:34:56 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.4</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13764096" author="cltlfcjin" created="Wed, 11 Sep 2013 08:05:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The patch is uploaded to address the issue. I wrap the file re-open behavior with a while loop. If FileNotFoundException caught, block  and continue to re-open the file.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13764173" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 11 Sep 2013 09:58:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the patch.&lt;br/&gt;
Do you also have a test case we could use?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13764191" author="cltlfcjin" created="Wed, 11 Sep 2013 10:29:42 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Well, the main purpose of this patch is to demonstrate the idea and the issue. &lt;br/&gt;
If you think it is OK, I will upload a patch with unit test soon afterwards.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13765283" author="cltlfcjin" created="Thu, 12 Sep 2013 08:57:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s a new patch with unit test. In function testIO398(), I simulate the rotate behavior which file can not be created immediately. &lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13765529" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 12 Sep 2013 15:27:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I&apos;ve been trying the unit test, and on Windows it sometimes fails to delete the file.&lt;br/&gt;
I assume that is because the tailer must have it open at the time.&lt;br/&gt;
The test can be updated to retry the delete.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This reveals an additional issue if the &quot;reopen&quot; option is true (as is required for Windows).&lt;br/&gt;
If the logger deletes/renames the file, the Tailer can fail with FileNotFoundException if the logger has not replaced the file by the time the wait has expired. This needs to be fixed before the &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-398&quot; title=&quot;listener.fileRotated() will be invoked more than one time in a real rotate activity&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-398&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;IO-398&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; test case is usable on Windows.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13766421" author="cltlfcjin" created="Fri, 13 Sep 2013 11:33:04 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I basically know what you mean. But I am not quite understand the mechanism of file lock in Windows OS.&lt;br/&gt;
For this patch, does it mean that it will be accepted after &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-399&quot; title=&quot;Tailer does not handle log file rotation properly if reOpen is true&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-399&quot;&gt;IO-399&lt;/a&gt; has been fixed? Or, should I provide another unit test to avoid the case on Windows.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13766626" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 13 Sep 2013 16:50:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;On Windows when the Tailer has the file open for read, it&apos;s not possible to delete the file. I&apos;ve not tested (yet), but I don&apos;t think it&apos;s possible to rename the file either. The locking issue is why the reOpen option was added.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Your unit test requires the file to be deleted/renamed. On Windows this can only be done whilst the Tailer is sleeping.&lt;br/&gt;
When it wakes up, it throws FileNotFoundException and stops processing. So it&apos;s not possible to run the unit test on Windows.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But it&apos;s not only on Windows that this behaviour will occur. If the Tailer is set to reOpen, the same can happen on Un*x.&lt;br/&gt;
Try it and see (I assume you are not testing on Windows).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So I think we need to fix the reOpen behaviour first, and then this bug can be addressed.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15980345" author="pascalschumacher" created="Sun, 23 Apr 2017 09:37:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;duplicates fixed issue &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-528&quot; title=&quot;Tailer.run race condition runaway logging&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-528&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;IO-528&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[IO-397] DeferredFileOutputStream is not removing temp file</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-397</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;We have a issue related to the fact that DeferredFileOutputStream is not removing the temporary file (created if we exceed threshold size) after the stream is closed. Would be nice to keep temp folder clean after work with output is done.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12667068">IO-397</key>
            <summary>DeferredFileOutputStream is not removing temp file</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>

            <title>[IO-395] [IO] Configurable Buffered Size</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-395</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Would be great if there was an environmental variable that could be set that would set the size of the IO Utils toBufferedInputStream/Writer for all invocations.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12662525">IO-395</key>
            <summary>[IO] Configurable Buffered Size</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/trivial.svg">Trivial</priority>

<item>
            <title>[IO-390] FileUtils.sizeOfDirectoryAsBigInteger can overflow</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-390</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FileUtils.sizeOfDirectoryAsBigInteger can overflow.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is because it calls FileUtils.sizeOf(file) which calls sizeOfDirectory() for processing subdirectories.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As it stands, the method only works properly at the top level.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A possible solution would be to create private &quot;Big&quot; versions of the called methods; these would not need all the checks so should be faster.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12657041">IO-390</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.sizeOfDirectoryAsBigInteger can overflow</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 10 Jul 2013 09:44:56 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 8 Nov 2016 17:59:12 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 10 Jul 2013 11:49:38 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.4</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.5</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13704469" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 10 Jul 2013 11:49:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;URL: &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/r1501735&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/r1501735&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Log:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-390&quot; title=&quot;FileUtils.sizeOfDirectoryAsBigInteger can overflow&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-390&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;IO-390&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
FileUtils.sizeOfDirectoryAsBigInteger can overflow.&lt;br/&gt;
Ensure that recursive calls all use BigInteger&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Modified:&lt;br/&gt;
    commons/proper/io/trunk/src/changes/changes.xml&lt;br/&gt;
    commons/proper/io/trunk/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/io/FileUtils.java&lt;br/&gt;
    commons/proper/io/trunk/src/test/java/org/apache/commons/io/FileUtilsTestCase.java&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[IO-389] FileUtils.sizeOfDirectory can throw IllegalArgumentException</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-389</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FileUtils.sizeOfDirectory has a small concurrency issue. Between the call to File.listFiles and the call to FileUtils.sizeOf, a file may be deleted. This can cause FileUtils.sizeOf to throw an IllegalArgumentException, indicating that the file does not exist.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12656997">IO-389</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.sizeOfDirectory can throw IllegalArgumentException</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="austind">Austin Doupnik</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 10 Jul 2013 01:26:36 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 8 Nov 2016 17:58:59 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 10 Jul 2013 12:12:13 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>2.5</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="13704085" author="austind" created="Wed, 10 Jul 2013 01:29:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This proposed fix ignores the IllegalArgumentException thrown by sizeOf.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13704354" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 10 Jul 2013 09:28:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I agree that the exception is unexpected and unhelpful.&lt;br/&gt;
However, rather than call FileUtils.sizeOf and catch the Exception it might be better to inline the main part of that code, i.e.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (file.isDirectory()) {
   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; sizeOfDirectory(file);
} &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;else&lt;/span&gt; {
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; file.length();
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Alternatively, create private versions that don&apos;t include the external checks.&lt;br/&gt;
For example, there&apos;s no point sizeOfDirectory checking if the file is a directory.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13704489" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 10 Jul 2013 12:12:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the report and patch.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-390&quot; title=&quot;FileUtils.sizeOfDirectoryAsBigInteger can overflow&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-390&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;IO-390&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; was fixed using the private method technique (new methods were needed for that anyway) so decided to use the same technique here.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;URL: &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/r1501744&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/r1501744&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Log:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-389&quot; title=&quot;FileUtils.sizeOfDirectory can throw IllegalArgumentException&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-389&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;IO-389&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; FileUtils.sizeOfDirectory can throw IllegalArgumentException&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Modified:&lt;br/&gt;
    commons/proper/io/trunk/src/changes/changes.xml&lt;br/&gt;
    commons/proper/io/trunk/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/io/FileUtils.java&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13704495" author="austind" created="Wed, 10 Jul 2013 12:23:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you for the quick response time!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="13704511" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 10 Jul 2013 12:40:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;No problem, thanks for the report! It&apos;s not something that unit tests are likely to spot.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It may be a while before the next release is generated.&lt;br/&gt;
If you wish to test the fix, our CI server generates snapshot builds if you don&apos;t wish to build from source.&lt;br/&gt;
Note that these are not reviewed or tested - absolutely no guarantees.&lt;br/&gt;
But if you are OK with that, they can be found in the ASF snapshot repo:&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[IO-386] FileUtils.doCopyFile uses different methods to check the file sizes</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-386</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FileUtils.doCopyFile uses FileChannel.size() to measure the input file length at the start, and File.length() to compare the lengths at the end.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is inconsistent.&lt;br/&gt;
If there is a good reason for this it should be documented, otherwise it should probably use the same method for all the checks.&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;Note: is FileChannel.size() accurate if the file has not been flushed?&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12650510">IO-386</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.doCopyFile uses different methods to check the file sizes</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>

Why not re-use the original value?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16075820" author="b.eckenfels" created="Thu, 6 Jul 2017 02:34:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;After discussion in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-544&quot; title=&quot;Should FileUtils.copyFile be flushed and synced before comparing file sizes?&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;IO-544&quot;&gt;IO-544&lt;/a&gt; I also wonder if the transferFrom returning 0 case does not need a few retries to avoid the length difference exception&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16285761" author="zhipengxu" created="Mon, 11 Dec 2017 10:59:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Can we save the length before copy really start and compare it with the new generated file ? &lt;br/&gt;

                            <comment id="16285804" author="b.eckenfels" created="Mon, 11 Dec 2017 11:39:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;You probably can compare it with the size at the beginning. If this is good or bad is a different question &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Can you tell us what you need to get fixed?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[IO-383] FileUtils.doCopyFile caches the file size; needs to be documented</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-383</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;FileUtils.doCopyFile saves the input file size before starting the copy.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The copy is considered complete when the original file size is reached.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The method then checks the new input file size against the destination size.&lt;br/&gt;
This will fail if the file has changed in size since the copy started.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This behaviour should be documented; also it would help if the two sizes were shown in the exception message.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12650502">IO-383</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.doCopyFile caches the file size; needs to be documented</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/trivial.svg">Trivial</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 2 Jun 2013 11:53:45 +0000</created>

                                    <watches>0</watches>

<item>
            <title>[IO-379] CharSequenceInputStream - add tests for available()</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-379</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;There are currently no tests for the available() method.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Tme method should return an estimate of the number of items remaining, so it should be possible to read - or skip - that many items without reaching EOF.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;At present, the code measures the number of CharBuf entries remaining; I think that is wrong - it should be the number of bytes left in the byte stream.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12643999">IO-379</key>
            <summary>CharSequenceInputStream - add tests for available()</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>

                    </labels>

                                        <due></due>

<item>
            <title>[IO-378] ClassLoaderInputStream - should this delegate to the parent class loader?</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-378</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;ClassLoaderInputStream currently delegates to its superclass if it cannot resolve the class itself.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This means it may resolve classes that are not in the specified class loader.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Consider whether to change this, or add an option to suppress the delegation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This would affect the resolveClass and resolveProxyClass methods.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12642933">IO-378</key>
            <summary>ClassLoaderInputStream - should this delegate to the parent class loader?</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 17 Apr 2013 14:12:09 +0000</created>

                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[IO-377] Tailer uses default charset to read the file</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-377</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The Tailer class reads bytes from a file and presents them to the TailerListener as Strings. The conversion from byte[] to String currently uses the default charset, which may not always be appropriate.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12642839">IO-377</key>
            <summary>Tailer uses default charset to read the file</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="2">Won&apos;t Fix</resolution>

<item>
            <title>[IO-374] WildcardFileFilter ctors should not use null to mean IOCase.SENSITIVE when delegating to other ctors</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-374</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;WildcardFileFilter ctors should not use null to mean IOCase.SENSITIVE when delegating to other ctors.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Just because null happens to mean case-sensitive, does not mean that internal calls to ctors should use that feature. It makes the code harder to read.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12641281">IO-374</key>
            <summary>WildcardFileFilter ctors should not use null to mean IOCase.SENSITIVE when delegating to other ctors</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 7 Apr 2013 21:46:15 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 8 Nov 2016 17:59:08 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 7 Apr 2013 22:09:08 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.4</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.5</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>

<item>
            <title>[IO-372] FileUtils.moveDirectory can produce misleading error message on failiure</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-372</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I am seeing the following error message when trying to move a directory:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&quot;Cannot move directory: /path/to/directory to a subdirectory of itself: /path/to/directory_renamed&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This statement is iincorrect the destination path is not a sub directory of the source path.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Looking at the source l.2752 the destination directory is being compared to the source directory without using a File.separator&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Here&apos;s a patch for the current trunk.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;Index: src/main/java/org/apache/commons/io/FileUtils.java
===================================================================
--- src/main/java/org/apache/commons/io/FileUtils.java	(revision 1453996)
+++ src/main/java/org/apache/commons/io/FileUtils.java	(working copy)
@@ -2803,7 +2803,7 @@
         }
         final boolean rename = srcDir.renameTo(destDir);
         if (!rename) {
-            if (destDir.getCanonicalPath().startsWith(srcDir.getCanonicalPath())) {
+            if (destDir.getCanonicalPath().startsWith(srcDir.getCanonicalPath() + File.separator)) {
                 throw new IOException(&quot;Cannot move directory: &quot;+srcDir+&quot; to a subdirectory of itself: &quot;+destDir);
             }
             copyDirectory( srcDir, destDir );
  &lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12635866">IO-372</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.moveDirectory can produce misleading error message on failiure</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="maxmil23">Max</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 7 Mar 2013 19:05:00 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 8 Nov 2016 17:58:58 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 16 Apr 2013 20:40:28 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>2.5</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>

<item>
            <title>[IO-371] FileUtils.copyDirectory and copyFile fail on AIX hosts over CIFS mounted directory</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IO-371</link>
                <project id="12310477" key="IO">Commons IO</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In a groovy script that imports org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils, I&apos;m trying to copy a directory from one location to another. Both locations are accessed through a mounted CIFS directory. When I try, I get this exception:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;java.io.IOException: A system call received a parameter that is not valid.
	at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.map0(Native Method)
	at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.map(FileChannelImpl.java:768)
	at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.transferFromFileChannel(FileChannelImpl.java:552)
	at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.transferFrom(FileChannelImpl.java:615)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.doCopyFile(FileUtils.java:1147)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.doCopyDirectory(FileUtils.java:1428)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.copyDirectory(FileUtils.java:1389)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.copyDirectory(FileUtils.java:1261)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.copyDirectory(FileUtils.java:1230)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils$copyDirectory.call(Unknown Source)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.CallSiteArray.defaultCall(CallSiteArray.java:45)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.call(AbstractCallSite.java:108)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.call(AbstractCallSite.java:120)
	at plutarch.archiveOldFilesOnSabrina(plutarch.groovy:111)
	at plutarch$archiveOldFilesOnSabrina.callCurrent(Unknown Source)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.CallSiteArray.defaultCallCurrent(CallSiteArray.java:49)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.callCurrent(AbstractCallSite.java:133)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.callCurrent(AbstractCallSite.java:149)
	at plutarch.run(plutarch.groovy:47)
	at groovy.lang.GroovyShell.runScriptOrMainOrTestOrRunnable(GroovyShell.java:257)
	at groovy.lang.GroovyShell.run(GroovyShell.java:220)
	at groovy.lang.GroovyShell.run(GroovyShell.java:150)
	at groovy.ui.GroovyMain.processOnce(GroovyMain.java:588)
	at groovy.ui.GroovyMain.run(GroovyMain.java:375)
	at groovy.ui.GroovyMain.process(GroovyMain.java:361)
	at groovy.ui.GroovyMain.processArgs(GroovyMain.java:120)
	at groovy.ui.GroovyMain.main(GroovyMain.java:100)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:60)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:37)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:611)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.tools.GroovyStarter.rootLoader(GroovyStarter.java:106)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.tools.GroovyStarter.main(GroovyStarter.java:128)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This executes normally on Windows using the same version of Java (1.6). Another user has a similar experience that makes me think this is an issue specific to AIX: &lt;a href=&quot;http://stackoverflow.com/questions/15092855/howto-copy-a-folder-and-all-its-content-in-java-recursively-including-symbolic&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://stackoverflow.com/questions/15092855/howto-copy-a-folder-and-all-its-content-in-java-recursively-including-symbolic&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Given the stack trace, this is probably something that Java 1.7 addressed, but it may be worthwhile for the copyDirectory and copyFile methods to provide a switch to handle symbolic links.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Java 1.6, AIX, FileUtils, Groovy 2.1.1, cifs&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12635685">IO-371</key>
            <summary>FileUtils.copyDirectory and copyFile fail on AIX hosts over CIFS mounted directory</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>

                            <comment id="13934930" author="ukslim" created="Fri, 14 Mar 2014 12:12:21 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;map() does not work on AIX CIFS mounts. You can demonstrate it with a short program:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;		File file = new File(path);&lt;br/&gt;
		FileInputStream stream = new FileInputStream(file);&lt;br/&gt;
		FileChannel channel = stream.getChannel();&lt;br/&gt;
		MappedByteBuffer buffer = &lt;br/&gt;
				channel.map(MapMode.READ_ONLY, 0, channel.size());&lt;/p&gt;
{/code}

&lt;p&gt;Throws: java.io.IOException: A system call received a parameter that is not valid &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;... on AIX CIFS mounts.&lt;/p&gt;
